658120364.name: Incredible
658120364.author: a TripAdvisor user
658120364.reviewBody: At the same time I\'m shocked this is a relatively unheard of destination (at least where i\'m from), I will say the lack of people there made it that much more special. I visited Cascada de Tamul in early Feb 2019. \n\nIn the general area, the waterfallOutstanding day

613626447.name: A exceptional view!!
613626447.author: a TripAdvisor user
613626447.reviewBody: While you are rowing you can admire the canyon is a beatiful show !! You Will exercise your self, swimming i\'m the waterfall is magical!!

488285292.name: Absolutely beautiful!
488285292.author: a TripAdvisor user
488285292.reviewBody: Didn\'t realize it was necessary to paddle 5K up stream for the view, but it was worth it! Fairly easy with a medium size group of about 10-12! also quite inexpensive.

482103705.name: Awesome experience
482103705.author: a TripAdvisor user
482103705.reviewBody: I went with friends. We went very very early with a guide called Carlos  ( you can find him in tanchichin camping, campamento santa anita). He suggested us to go very early (7 am) that way we wouldnt be with a lot of people and indeed, we were the only ones arriving there so the pictures are awesome. We managed to be very near the fall, which is impossible to do when there are a lot of people. It was great. After that, we enjoyed the cenote, alone once again. And then, 30 min after, like 50 people arrived. We are grateful to have found this guide. He was a very good guide because he was telling us about stories that happened in the region, talking about the fauna and flora, and the love he has for the tamul\'s fall. Great person. I recommend him!

475669063.name: The best of our roadtrip!
475669063.author: a TripAdvisor user
475669063.reviewBody: Suddenly you are in a river, bluer than anything you\'ve seen. Fresh waters, nice canoes to row and an amazing waterfall.

472731606.name: The most gorgeous waterfall I\'ve ever seen!
472731606.author: a TripAdvisor user
472731606.reviewBody: Rappelling down to see this waterfall from the bottom was probably one of the best things I\'ve done in my life up until now. It was the most gorgeous thing I\'ve ever seen and I felt like I couldn\'t take it in enough!

456555556.name: Amazing waterfall
456555556.author: a TripAdvisor user
456555556.reviewBody: This waterfall is  a must when you visit La Huateca, swuim in this beautiful waters, and a beautiful view of waterfalls

444620571.name: Truly spectacular views
444620571.author: a TripAdvisor user
444620571.reviewBody: We visited Tamul in  a group with others from the hotel. You should arrive early to avoid lots of people and bear in mind that before you see the waterfall you need to paddle upriver for an hour or so, which is tiring but worth it. We floated back down the river which was also a great experience. I think it\'s best to book this with a hotel or tour company as they have the best connections locally and we received two really great guides with all the equipment and knowledge necessary. Plus it is a little complicated to find!

664306736.name: a fascinating spot
664306736.author: a TripAdvisor user
664306736.reviewBody: i had a lovely walk there with a friend who is an art student at the school.  i was pleased to learn that the city is so supportive of the arts.  it is also interesting that they have preserved this architectural gem and converted a former jail to a positive social use.  the government of san luis potosi seems to be very progressive, with many social programs to support its citizens.  i also enjoyed the beautiful promenade adjacent as well as the cathedral of our lady of guadalupe.  the lavender jacaranda trees in bloom against the colorful buildings were charming and colorful.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de las Artes de San Luis Potosi Centenario

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Guadalupe 705 Julian Carrillo, Centro historico

659082566.name: Wonderful recently renovated building and centre.
659082566.author: a TripAdvisor user
659082566.reviewBody: This was previously the town prison, but it has been magnificently re-invented by Taller 6A, and is worth going to see if only for the architectural spaces alone.  However there are also exhibitions and it where the Museum dedicated to the work of Leonora Carrington is.  This is mainly the late sculptures and pieces, rather than any paintings or drawings, but possibly with time, they will be able to obtain more earlier work.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de las Artes de San Luis Potosi Centenario

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Guadalupe 705 Julian Carrillo, Centro historico

651898341.name: A MUST!
651898341.author: a TripAdvisor user
651898341.reviewBody: We went to "El Mercadito."  It is a one-day event every month, where crafts, antiques and unique Mexican things are sold.  This location used to be a prison and was marvelously refurbished into an Art Center, which includes the Leonora Carrington Museum inside of it.  It is simply one of the best art locations to visit in San Luis Potosi.  If you are in town, and like arts, take half a day to visit, it is worth it.  It usually has other events going on, open to the public, and even a theater that presents unique plays by known and unknown directors.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de las Artes de San Luis Potosi Centenario

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Guadalupe 705 Julian Carrillo, Centro historico

631655711.name: A jail transformed in an Arts Center
631655711.author: a TripAdvisor user
631655711.reviewBody: In a building that was a former jail, the government of San Luis Potosi proposes the Arts Center. Several attractions are included in this center: The building itself has been renovated and it is a huge place to walk around and enjoy the different areas, you should take a guided visit. In addition, one famous prisoner, Mr. Madero, president of Mexico at the beginning of the Revolution lived there and his prison is open to visitors. There are several activities such as cine-club, concerts, exhibitions. The special area of Leonora Carrington is a museum of international importance.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de las Artes de San Luis Potosi Centenario

617108759.name: History and renewal in one place
617108759.author: a TripAdvisor user
617108759.reviewBody: I visited the Centre right after they relocated the inmates. The place gave you goosebumps! The change, purification and rebirth into a Centre of Arts has been marvelous. Definitely worth a visit!!!

There is a long parkway that leads to long and narrow shopping streets that merge on the area by the Cathedral.  Well worth a visit.  Airlines from Dallas fly into the city so not hard to get to

I wouldn\'t take small children.

664531192.name: Beautiful place - and a couple of things to be cautious about
664531192.author: a TripAdvisor user
664531192.reviewBody: Xilitla is a beautiful \u201cPueblo m\u00e1gico\u201d. To visit the convent in the main plaza is a must. Also, the museum of Leonora Carrington is nearby and some time spent there is worth it. You can enjoy some tasty and cheap local food in the restaurants close to the town centre. A few kilometers from the town you can find the surrealist garden created by Edward James, a wonderful place created by the wild imagination of this artist. However, as beautiful as the town and the surroundings are, if you are driving, be careful not to park in the main square, the municipal government is full of crooks whose purpose is not that you enjoy your stay, but to extract money from you by means of issuing a ticket to you for parking in places that only them know it is prohibited: nowhere in the square there is a single indication of that. Also, if you drive to the surrealist garden, you will have to parallel park in the road and the same government \u201cassigned\u201d some guys to \u201cguard\u201d the cars and they are very pushy and aggressive collecting parking fees. If you do not \u201ccooperate\u201d, your car may suffer some \u201cincidental\u201d damages. The town\u2019s people are great, we had the assistance of a couple of locals so kind that they guided us closely when trying to pay the fine and get out of the town on our way to Ciudad Valles. They sweetened a bit the bitter taste of the extortion we suffered in the two places I mentioned above. If you pay attention to that, you will enjoy your visit to the town.

664310989.name: surrealism lives in the cloud forest
664310989.author: a TripAdvisor user
664310989.reviewBody: a once in a lifetime experience, though i would surely return if possible.  any art lover would be blown away by this experience.  wear comfortable shoes, lightweight clothing with a bathing suit underneath.  the restaurant inside of las pozas is excellent as well.  recommended for those in good shape and able to climb steep hills.

617117273.name: Xilitla: a beautiful ride by bus through the gorgeous Serra Gorda to hot and humid Xilitla.
617117273.author: a TripAdvisor user
617117273.reviewBody: Xilitla is a hot and humid small pueblo magic up in the Sierra Gorda. The main attraction is the Jardin Surealistico Las Pozas a few kilometers outside of town. Xilitla itself is worth an hour or two of exploring, its surroundings are very pretty. Helpful would be to have your own car since there is probably so much to explore here. I took a bus to the Jardin and after the visit took a bus up to a viewpoint near a pretty hotel that rents interesting cabins with panorama.

613668054.name: Vacations to die for

582047485.name: Edward James Castle
582047485.author: a TripAdvisor user
582047485.reviewBody: An Eden tucked away in the jungle for \ngenerations of people to come and admire.  Truly a must see location that is unexpected.  Our visit was extraordinary.  Requires a lot of walking, hiking, climbing, and if you would like-  even swimming.  If visiting the Huasteca Potosina make the extra drive to Xilitla and visit this un ordinary place hidden away in the jungle.

656444297.name: Fabulous
656444297.author: a TripAdvisor user
656444297.reviewBody: Very nice clean safe and close \nGood places to eat hospitality is just great \nThis is jewel and deserves to be visited.

653576986.name: Loved it!
653576986.author: a TripAdvisor user
653576986.reviewBody: Such a beautiful and atmospheric area.\nWe visited on a weekday and almost had the town to ourselves.  Some workers and several friendly dogs around.  Only one cafe for drinks and snacks, but several others would be open on weekends.  \nDefinitely worth the trip and a lot closer than Real de Catorce.

address.streetAddress: Entrada principal Cerro de San Pedro

568691976.name: Old mining town
568691976.author: a TripAdvisor user
568691976.reviewBody:
I don't know if I'd classify this as a ghost town since most of the people settled in San Luis Potosí near the water source, 20km away, and the mine is active once again, but what few structures the town built have been abandoned, so there's that. 

Mining in the San Pedro Hills began in 1592 and continued off and on until 1950, yielding almost 3 million ounces of gold and 40 million ounces of silver, resulting in a reputation comparable to the mines of Bolivia.  Due to the lack of water in the area, the town developed in San Luis Potosí, about 45 minutes away. 

The San Pedro Mine is once again active, yielding gold, silver, limestone, zinc, lead sulphide, and other minerals. It contains a reserve of over 71 million tons of minerals, over 50 million ounces of which are believed to be gold and silver. 

The town itself is extremely small,  containing a few buildings, a small plaza, and a temple, which was not open. A two room museum provides history of the mine and a guided tour to an overlook of the restricted mining area. Only from here could we see the mining layers of the pit that dynamite has chipped away, and the trucks leaving the site, laden with stone.  Unfortunately, visitors are not allowed to take pictures inside this restricted area. 

Explosion times are advertised and we were lucky enough to visit on one of these days. We waited in town for the 3:00 detonation. We then heard and felt the rumble of the explosion - very similar an earthquake, but the sensation was more surreal.  

If you're going to go out of your way to visit here,  know that it is very small and unremarkable to look at. The value is in its history and being treated to a dynamite detonation nearby. Don't pass up the homemade gorditas made by a woman and her family in the little plaza by the church. Best gorditas I've ever eaten, and I've eaten tons throughout many states in Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Entrada principal Cerro de San Pedro

489924770.name: Unsurprisingly beautiful
489924770.author: a TripAdvisor user
489924770.reviewBody: This place is perfect for a day trip outside SLP. For those looking for less mainstream locations, this is definitely the one to choose.\n\nTip: you can buy very beautiful and cheap silver jewelry!

address.streetAddress: Entrada principal Cerro de San Pedro

422665773.name: A Unique place (ghost town) to visit and must do!
422665773.author: a TripAdvisor user
422665773.reviewBody: We went here after reading 1 line about it in a travelguide not expecting much. When we arrived ( on a monday) the only place with people was the town hall. make sure you go there and tell them you are visiting. With any luck the right person is there to show you around and tell you about the history and current progress. We really appreciated the time that was put into snowing us around and will tell everyone to visit here as well! \nApparantly in the weekend the place is Packed, so if you want the ghost town experience go during the week.

address.streetAddress: Entrada principal Cerro de San Pedro

411630280.name: Mexican Flair
411630280.author: a TripAdvisor user
411630280.reviewBody: To be honest, there is not a lot to do, but I enjoyed a lazy Saturday Lunch in this special mexican village. \nIt got a real special flair, kind of surreal!

address.streetAddress: Entrada principal Cerro de San Pedro

631500900.name: Very nice place to learn science
631500900.author: a TripAdvisor user
631500900.reviewBody: How to spend a nice time while learning? El Laberinto is a very nice, clean, organized and informative museum, where children and adults may have a good experience about sciences, physics, electricity, biology. Once a month there is a special evening where everybody can enjoy 4 or 5 hours of relax with science topics.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Antonio Rocha Cordero S/N, Col. Tierra Blanca

631259919.author: a TripAdvisor user
631259919.reviewBody:
Lots of science based exhibits and hands on tools for kids to learn. Cool enough to keep adults interested too.

Not a true laberynth just some cactus gardens and animals.

All in all we spent an hour or two wondering around.

Have Fun!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Antonio Rocha Cordero S/N, Col. Tierra Blanca

An excellent place to visit on your own or along with the family. Kids have fun and learn at the same time. It is also enriching for adults as well.
Different topics to be learned found inplace

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Antonio Rocha Cordero S/N, Col. Tierra Blanca

444559277.name: The best place to go with children
444559277.author: a TripAdvisor user
444559277.reviewBody: This is the only intereactive museum in the city. The volunteers attend nicely and treat the children kindly. They are awesome at explaining and helping out. The areas are divided in a different way than at other science museums, art and science are mingled together and are divided into space, nature, colors dn the such. The temporal exhibitions are very good. It includes an imax and the once a month night program is also unique.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Antonio Rocha Cordero S/N, Col. Tierra Blanca

431635848.name: Great 3D movie theater, awesome museum, great cafeteria, spotless clean
431635848.author: a TripAdvisor user
431635848.reviewBody:
"Museo Laberinto" is located in "Parque Tangamanga" but you need to be careful because Google Maps is not updated and the entrance is not from within the park but more from where "Plaza San Luis" is located.

The 3D movie theater is awesome, great image, audio, clean.

The cafeteria has a ton of options, super cheap.

The different halls are full of interesting expositions and full of eager staff with a ton of great information.

They have the best area for kids 1 - 5 years old, full of helpful staff and a ton of activities which can keep any baby entertained for hours.

In my opinion, the best option in all of San Luis Potosi for familes with babies / young kids.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Antonio Rocha Cordero S/N, Col. Tierra Blanca

419957892.name: Absolutely Fantastic
419957892.author: a TripAdvisor user
419957892.reviewBody: On the edge of the large Parque Tangamango, so a bit out of the way, But worth a trip especially if you have children. The buildings are an architectural wonder and the three labyrinths created by cacti quite beautiful. but it is really a child\'s delight: too many to list. Every game/event, et al has a helpful youngster to explain, coax, guard. it is unique in my travels of the world.\nBRAVO SAN LUIS!!

Great place!! the temporary shows are usually great, I have been to 2 or 3 of these ones and they have been quite good.

The building itself is great! cons:  The food is awful, and the personnel sometimes can be overzealous and strict.  They wouldn't let me have the baby bag full of diapers and sweaters and such (even if it is summer the ac is a full blast in some of the rooms), and I had to leave it outside...
