660175640.author: a TripAdvisor user
660175640.reviewBody: This is an amazing park located right by city centre proximity, and with fare share of good parking space and many attractions like the big lake, many kids entertainment infrastructures and large areas of trees and grass so people can have a picnic, run, take a rest,etc. On of the best in city parks I have ever been.

644174309.name: Great place to run
644174309.author: a TripAdvisor user
644174309.reviewBody: We go here every weekend to run. It\'s a huge park with many places to run. I usually run around the triangular 2 mile paved trail in the center of the park, but I also enjoy running around the pond or along the ridge next to the Periferico. There are a number of playgrounds, sports fields, picnic tables, grills, etc. There\'s even a small zoo that doesn\'t have an entry fee. The cars all observe the 20 kph speed limit, so it\'s very safe to run, walk, bike or rollerblade on the streets.

638889183.name: Excellent for exercising!
638889183.author: a TripAdvisor user
638889183.reviewBody: The nice thing of the park is that it opens really early (5:00 am) and it has a lot of options of things to do. It is safe and also big enough to run long distances.

631666494.name: Great place to make outdor activities
631666494.author: a TripAdvisor user
631666494.reviewBody: nice place to make outdor activities such as walking,jogging,runnning, bycicling, there are also some footbol soccer courts, soccer tournaments by local teams,pool working only at summer, a small zoo.

614136804.name: Nice option for runners
614136804.author: a TripAdvisor user
614136804.reviewBody: Let\u2019s suppose that you\u2019re in town for business, but also you love running outdoor\u2019s, if that\u2019s the case you could take your sneakers and a Uber to take you to this place, I found a 8 km circuit and very quiet, flat.\nEnjoy the local community of runners!

610843065.name: An enjoyable family place
610843065.author: a TripAdvisor user
610843065.reviewBody: Beautiful an Unique place for sightseeing or relaxing along with family. Perfect for jogging or other sports practicing as well. Tangamanga park represents an excepcional place for which many other cities don\'t have the privilege to count on within. Also an important air loung for the city. And best of all is totaly free!

609633424.name: The jaguar was napping
609633424.author: a TripAdvisor user
609633424.reviewBody: What a lovely afternoon drive through the park. So many interesting areas and the zoo area was new to me.

598903517.name: A huge park, but no place in weekends
598903517.author: a TripAdvisor user
598903517.reviewBody: This is one of the biggest parks in Latin America as told by the local residents. In fact it was very big. But if you want to spend some time in this park in the weekend, you can forget it. It is completely crowded by whole city.

588489993.name: Awesome Park!
588489993.author: a TripAdvisor user
588489993.reviewBody: This is a jewel in the city of San Luis Potosi in Mexico, the hole park is in good conditions and you can do all sorts of sports, but running and cycling (road and mountain bike) are the main sports, it even has a lake and they have their own national triathlon once a year. San Luis Potosi has a semi desert climate, so it is incredible to see the amount of trees that cover the hole area, it takes a lot of maintenance and they do it well. During the weekends you will see a lot of people hanging around and enjoying their picnics. The park is fenced all around and there is a good amount of security with in. Come and visit, it is worth it!

578637509.name: go for a run
578637509.author: a TripAdvisor user
578637509.reviewBody: weather was great and the park has alot of space for you to get in a good run. the park has fencing which added to the safety.

564005472.name: What a wonderful part of the city of San Luis Potosi
564005472.author: a TripAdvisor user
564005472.reviewBody:
I was surprised and awed by this wonderful park in the city of San Luis. I did not expect to encounter such a large park in this city, and it is within walking distance of where I am living for a few months. The park is huge and has so much space and places for various activities from sports, to picnics, to walking and cycling. You regularly encounter people who are training/running and families having picnics. There is a self-directed walking trail which explains the local flora and fauna. There is a lake (not for swimming) that has ducks and other waterfowl. Too many things to describe here.
The park has a very slow speed limit, which people are very good at obeying. This makes for a very safe place to walk for everyone.
My husband and I really enjoyed the park, even just for sitting and relaxing.
You can rent bikes, and buy snacks, but the park is not overrun with vendors.
I definitely recommend checking it out if you visit San Luis!

563314515.name: One of the best parks and biggest
563314515.author: a TripAdvisor user
563314515.reviewBody: I really enjoy going to this park because there are a lot of things that you can do there, is one of the biggest parks in Mexico and it worth it. What should be improved here is the maintenance there are some areas that really need it. Good place to do some exercise, to enjoy with friends or family.

560284997.name: Beautiful
560284997.author: a TripAdvisor user
560284997.reviewBody: This is a huge beautiful park located right in the city. Some lakes, lots of runners, and a vast forest all make this an interesting place to visit.

559466277.name: Looking for a place to run
559466277.author: a TripAdvisor user
559466277.reviewBody: Right in the middle of the city this large park offers several routes to run.\nI did a 12K run and wish I had had more time to run longer.

540956118.name: Big, safe, and beautiful
540956118.author: a TripAdvisor user
540956118.reviewBody:
This is an enormous park in a great part of SLP. It's huge providing miles of hiking and biking trails. It is pretty busy in the mornings, but seems nearly empty weekday afternoons. So green and so clean.

Sadly (for us), no dogs allowed.

539311998.name: Interesting
539311998.author: a TripAdvisor user
539311998.reviewBody: A very big and interesting park with some intriguing sculptures.  The day I went was not too crowded and I enjoyed strolling around and taking in some fresh air.

527687420.name: boring place
527687420.author: a TripAdvisor user
527687420.reviewBody: Unless you are going to have picnic very boring.Although it is nice that the city has so much green space for the community.

516349373.name: Family and friends time in nature inside of a city
516349373.author: a TripAdvisor user
516349373.reviewBody: The second bigger park in Mexico! It has inside a mini zoo, museum, swimming park, and mini theater where they actually have events. The personal take care a lot of the park is really nice! Perfect for a walk or party with a barbecue!

509005500.name: One of the best activities in the city
509005500.author: a TripAdvisor user
509005500.reviewBody: This an amazing park and one of the biggest in Mexico. It has a lot of places to do different activities at open air. One of the landmarks of San Luis Potosi and it is also very well preserved in almost every part.

507113956.name: Nice park
507113956.author: a TripAdvisor user
507113956.reviewBody: Nice park for running or working out. Several routes possible and many places to stop for a short workout. A good place to go when the weather is nice.

485340222.name: Very large all inclusive park!
485340222.author: a TripAdvisor user
485340222.reviewBody: Great park for any activities! It has a zoo snd a good size water park! Great for a picnic or if you just want a beautiful place to stroll, jog or run. There are also various play areas for the children, including soccer fields!

458090035.name: Breath of Fresh Air
458090035.author: a TripAdvisor user
458090035.reviewBody: This is a huge park, great to go cycling, running or walking.  Lots of vendors in case you get hungry or thirsty.  A family environment.

451780339.name: Runner\'s Dream
451780339.author: a TripAdvisor user
451780339.reviewBody: Our Trip to San Luis Potosi began in Mexico City where we took a bus (ETN Buses - inexpensive, SAFE and EXTREMELY comfortable, with touch screen tv with movies and games. We took the bus at midnight and arrived at 5:30 am) We took a local bus down town and we walked to through the city awaiting for business to open. We had breakfast in a "fonda," or tiny restaurant with "homemade" style of "comida corrida," or establishment selected meal for minimal cost. We walked and took pictures before the all the other tourist woke up!!! then took a tour on a historical trolly. We stayed in Casa Catalina and drove to Parque Tamgamanga in the morning for a GREAT RUN!! The park is clean and is just a delight for runners.

451725635.name: Great for wildlife and leisure
451725635.author: a TripAdvisor user
451725635.reviewBody: I stay next door to the park so visit it regularly. It is a massive green oasis in a city of concrete in an arid region. Cyclists, runners, family\'s having barbecues mingle with the wildlife. As a bird watcher this park should be on any fellow birders itinerary if you visit central Mexico. Many exotic flycatchers, egrets and cormorants. Plus a wide variety of dragonflies. \n\nPark is closed Monday afternoons and observe the 20km speed limit. Well worth a visit any time of year.

445717233.name: Clean, nice, free
445717233.author: a TripAdvisor user
445717233.reviewBody: Very nice park.  Allowed to grill.  some benches.  Vendors on site as well.  Very clean.  There are some covered areas.  Playing fields for sports.

442375612.name: Get a tree fix here.
442375612.author: a TripAdvisor user
442375612.reviewBody: This park is huge. My husband and I came here for a place to walk on a Sunday late morning. There are also places where a person can rent a bicycles to tool around on the flat roads, bring a mountain bike or 4 wheeler, play f\u00fatbol, feed ducks, fly your RC planes... There are picnic tables and barbecue grills tucked here and there. So, for city dwellers, it is a place to get some room to breathe and get a tree fix. \nAs a park experience overall, though, Tangamanga is so-so. The trees, although a welcome sight, were not planted with a sense of any  landscape plan other than to cram in  as many trees as possible, and most are introduced species like eucalyptus and pepper trees. Didn\'t notice any floral gardens. There was a "nature trail" that didn\'t yield very much information. \nSo to summarize, Tangamanga offers a lot of room to wander but it is visually uninteresting.

431965032.name: Beautiful park, tons of activities, huge part of San Luis Potosi, family oriented
431965032.author: a TripAdvisor user
431965032.reviewBody:
"Parque Tangamanga" is a big part of San Luis Potosi, crowded during the weekends but plenty of parking and space for everyone.

There's bike rentals, baseball diamonds, soccer fields, archery, tracks for quad motorcycles, motocross, etc etc etc

Bathrooms and trashcans just about everywhere, police presence inside the park so obey the speeding limit.

Great place to visit, kill time, do excercise etc...a must in San Luis Potosi.

418211273.name: For any occasion
418211273.author: a TripAdvisor user
418211273.reviewBody: If you want to run, read, relax, walk, play, talk, swim, ride a bicycle or eat you should definitely go to Tangamanga Park, it\'s free, clean and green. A must go when you are in San Luis Potosi.

405049854.name: G R E E N !!!
405049854.author: a TripAdvisor user
405049854.reviewBody:
Very beautiful park !!! Fantastic for you and your family !!! Several areas where you can make your own barbecue or picnic!  

Perfect for meditation, sports, exercises or just to be connected with the nature.

The only negative is you can not bring your dog.

399033659.name: Nice visit but warning no bathrooms
399033659.author: a TripAdvisor user
399033659.reviewBody: Ok there are bathrooms but disgusting. So practically no bathrooms. But this park is beautiful on a hot day it felt really cool lots of shade, play areas, bike areas, walking areas. Great for a family day at the park to grill we brought our own, found nice area to park and a spot close to the cars. Plenty of room, we went late afternoon on a Sunday.

388391445.name: Walk/Excersice and fun with children
388391445.author: a TripAdvisor user
388391445.reviewBody:
Nice relaxing atmosphere for a walk or run, excellent for children to play any sport, museum available for entertainment.

If I'm location worth the visit.

382908762.name: True walk in the woods
382908762.author: a TripAdvisor user
382908762.reviewBody: Open early everyday to get some exercise. Amazing to see all lot of people walking, running, biking, preparing for special competition in this beautiful park. Has an open theater for perhaps a concert or a simple, fun family oriented picnic.

376279027.name: Great Park
376279027.author: a TripAdvisor user
376279027.reviewBody: Went rollerblading, hills can be a little bit of a challenge. Great workout. You can log alot of miles.

375192391.name: Need of a break
375192391.author: a TripAdvisor user
375192391.reviewBody: Look here there is no other way to say it but here goes: if you need a break, nature time, or exercise this is the place for you. \nIt even has a plane with a TV inside so kids can stay there while you go on walk with a friend/family member/significant other etc

363213749.name: Everything related to Sports
363213749.author: a TripAdvisor user
363213749.reviewBody: Somebody who wants to spend his weekend by playing soccer, basketball, volleyball,  football, rugby, tennis, swimming, running, etc., is right here. A lot of places to Picknick with your family. Good for smaller kids to old people. The only negative thing is, that the park closes very early.

359320983.name: relexing place
359320983.author: a TripAdvisor user
359320983.reviewBody: beaufiful. half day course. good for picnic. and inside there is ciencia museum. it is so good! i strongly recommnend to visit ciencia museo.

325999942.name: Amazing place!
325999942.author: a TripAdvisor user
325999942.reviewBody:
This park is in my hometown, it is a big space with lots of trees, bicycle tracks, playgrounds for little kids, a lake, it has grilling facilities also
There is a speed limit for cars so it's great for working out (running, cycling, skating, etc) there are soccer, baseball, football, tennis, basketball courts and fields 
Closes early on winter time (6 pm) but it opens really early in the morning, closed on Mondays
Safe and beautiful

314673413.name: Exactly 10 km girth!
314673413.author: a TripAdvisor user
314673413.reviewBody: If you can\'t give up training even when you are on holiday and you need an interesting path that measures exactly 10 km (six and a quarter miles) to run daily, this is the park you need, because it\'s circumference is exactly 10 kilometers if you keep running along the trail next to the fence. The hour will pass before you even notice it, as there are parts of the park covered in vegetation and shadow and other parts where you\'ll be running in the open sun (remember you are in the desert of the Mexican mesa). The entrance to the park is free, and there are some spots where you can get drinks and snacks for reasonable prices.

298309258.name: Nice city park, not really a tourist attraction
298309258.author: a TripAdvisor user
298309258.reviewBody:
This is a large urban park. As such, it is impressive and a good place to spend an afternoon alone, with your sweetie, or with the family. It has many different things to do/see, but isn't an "attraction"  per sé. If you're looking to spend an afternoon relaxing at the park, this is the ideal place to go.
      Features:
1. This is the 2nd largest urban park in Mexico (The 1st being Chapultepec in Mexico City) with 411 hectares of green trees, man-made lakes, and grassy areas
2. There's an aquatic park inside with an indoor pool, shallow outdoor pool, outdoor wave pool, 4 waterslides, and a kiddie pool with play structure. There are a few snack and drink stands, many tables with shade structures, some bbq pits, basketball and volleyball courts on concrete, and an indoor weight room. 
- It's 60 pesos adult entry for the day ($4), which is a good deal when everything is running. I looked around inside on Aug 1st and the pools were half-filled and the waterslides weren't running. They told me they were having problems with the water that day. Idk if that's the case, but I advise you to do what I did and sweet-talk security into letting you look around a bit first. 
3. An observatory (planetarium).  I think once a month (last Thursday..?) it's free. 
4. An interactive science museum (Laberinto) that is supposed to be very good. 
5. A regional museum
6. A gym with a wall of windows facing the lake
7. A natural-ish pond with ducks and a larger, man-made lake for canoeing, fishing
8. An outdoor theater
9. Fountains (that sometimes run. There doesn't seem to be a scheduled time/day) and many bronze statues of people who were influential in developing the culture and city of San Luis.
10. Soccer fields, walking/jogging paths
11. Picnic tables and some bbq pits
12. Playgrounds

City buses (yellow) can be caught in downtown San Luis by the Centro or Caja de Agua and will stop here. It's about a 10-12 min drive by car from the Caja de Agua/San Miguelito area downtown. 

In sum, if you're looking for city history, monuments, culture, and photo ops, there are many other sites in town that are more ideal.  However, if you're looking for some low-key family activities, or a relaxing day in a tranquil atmosphere, this is the place. 

Hope that helps!  Happy travels!

277742719.name: A place to spend the afternoon
277742719.author: a TripAdvisor user
277742719.reviewBody: I was there for almost a full afternoon. If you go by foot you can spend the entire day. The Park is well kept and there are a lot of thing to do. I had the change to feed some squirrels.

277644435.name: Not a tourist attraction.
277644435.author: a TripAdvisor user
277644435.reviewBody: While it is a great park.  More then 12 grass Soccer fields. Alot of baseball fields and a Water park, an outdoor theater,  ATV rental, Skating Rink, the only American Football field in SLP, and even a Model Airplane hobbiest airstrip, this is not a tourist attraction. Bathrooms are not well placed here and in some cases too far away from the Soccer fields.\n\n It\'s great that SLP has this park an in fact there is another one Tangamanga 2.  I have no idea what a tourist would do here.  A tourist would be hard pressed to find a Taxi in the middle of the park, and it\'s too huge to be walking around for sure. I would recommend Parque Morales for strolling around rather then this one.

277248141.name: Nice park
277248141.author: a TripAdvisor user
277248141.reviewBody: Nice park to spend a day in... good place to take the kids. Crowded on weekends. Barbeque grills are available, just make sure you are comfortable with public grills (i.e. higiene). Lots of space for the kids to run and play, or for impromptu football (soccer).

275845667.name: Very Well Kept Park!
275845667.author: a TripAdvisor user
275845667.reviewBody: I went here with my girlfrend and her young son. The tables were set up so you could have privacy. Our little guy played soccer with the youngsters and had lots of fun. The Park has a lot of character and was dedicated to the people of San Luis Potosi. Its about 400 plus hectares and attracts foreigners and local Mexican folks

262758076.name: An expansive urban park with many fun things today in SLP!
262758076.author: a TripAdvisor user
262758076.reviewBody: An expansive urban park with many fun things today in SLP! We went around the man made lake ... then we walked around some other sections of the park ... excellent!

255523622.name: An oasis in the city!
255523622.author: a TripAdvisor user
255523622.reviewBody: The Parque Tangmanga is 420 hectares of green grass and trees, playground, hiking/biking/walking, live performance venue and museum on the south side of San Luis Potosi.  The signs indicating specific destinations could be improved, but it is a most wonderful place to enjoy an afternoon. There is a bike rental stand, a water slide area and acres of green.  By the time we found the labrinth and science museum, the day was gone.  We\'ll hire a taxi to return to experience the labrinth tomorrow.

252516015.name: A place to really relax
252516015.author: a TripAdvisor user
252516015.reviewBody:
Tangamanga Park, with its two sections in different parts of the city, is the second biggest public park in Mexico, and it shows: few cities in the arid parts of Mexico have the fortune of having such open, big, green spaces for their inhabitants and visitors to enjoy.

Tangamanga Park has, as expected, wide swaths of forested land, along with sports installations, lakes and a small zoo. Contiguous to it is the Laberinto Museum, also worth a visit - specially if traveling with children. 

There are, however, two hidden jewels inside the Tangamanga Park concept. One is its availability: in contrast with Chapultepec in Mexico City, when we visited Tangamanga, we didn't have the feeling of having crowds upon us, so one can really relax in the open spaces. The other is that it strives to create a culture of civility: 20 kph speed limits are strictly enforced, and one is encouraged to "greet and smile" your fellow park goers.

240891759.name: This is not supposed to be a tourist attraction
240891759.author: a TripAdvisor user
240891759.reviewBody: It is hard to rate this park considering it as a tourist attraction because it is the place is a place design for the locals to exercise and have small barbecues and parties. This doesn\'t mean that it\'s not a beautiful place especially considering how hard it is to maintain a place like that between the city\'s weather. Don\'t expect to have fun at the park if you are not planning to exercise or something of that nature.

237912474.name: The city\'s greenest spot
237912474.author: a TripAdvisor user
237912474.reviewBody: San Luis is a very dry city, this park is awesome. You can find green spots for a picnic, playgrounds, tennis courts, soccer fields, volleyball nets, basketball courts, a small theater, a very large one too, a bike route, botanical garden, green nursery, a science museum, skating and hockey areas, a deer and ostrich reserve, and with the exception of the waterpark and the science museum there is no entrance fee. Drawbacks... not nice restrooms. And it closes on mondays. ...ups and make sure you lock your car well and do not leave any valuables in sight.

230546313.name: excellent park
230546313.author: a TripAdvisor user
230546313.reviewBody: I come here almost every sunday to bike for two hours.  it\'s very large and the bike trails are okay - certainly better than being killed on the suburban roads by idiot drivers.  I do enjoy the ride even though there are not rules about keeping on the right side of the road, walkers and runners just walk anyway they like but as long as you don\'t let this irritate you, you should enjoy it.  the enormous park has lots of attractions and is very pretty and if you\'re so inclined you could even have a picnic and a barbecue.  also plenty of restrooms all over the place.

228853943.name: Just an average place
228853943.author: a TripAdvisor user
228853943.reviewBody: Nothing great bout this park. Good place to walk and bike and do your running. Can barbeque too when weather permits.

226245646.name: Amazing park
226245646.author: a TripAdvisor user
226245646.reviewBody: Very nice park full of life and things to do, there is a couple museums in there they are not worth it to me, found them dull, but the park itself is a landmark for this city

222994621.name: Great place to share time with family, or do exercise.
222994621.author: a TripAdvisor user
222994621.reviewBody: You can spend the day if you care to.  It is an excellent family time together place, sports, museums, exercise, cook food, picnic, perfect for competition for running, playing sports, no pets are allowed neither alcohol, so it  is a fantastic place to spend time together.  Take your bike or rent, full of trees, grass, and safe.

201288141.name: Excelent place to enjoy with the family or friends
201288141.author: a TripAdvisor user
201288141.reviewBody: This is a free access park with extense green areas, a big artificial lake, kids game areas, etc. There are even a museum, planetarium, a small convention center and botanical centers. The park is mostly free and you can go to a small camp, enjoying, relaxing or to exercise. A small drawback is the closing time at 6 pm

155026599.name: Family time
155026599.author: a TripAdvisor user
155026599.reviewBody:
Great park!

It is a great place to spend some family time.  There are bike rentals (weekends only,  I think), Bbq pits, many people go there for birthday parties, it has a very big runway for RC planes. Of course you can find soccer and beisball fields.  No alcohol drinking and no pets.

Lots of trees and green areas...

150428445.name: I believe this park is the biggest in the city
150428445.author: a TripAdvisor user
150428445.reviewBody: One of the best attractions is parque TANGAMANGA. Huge park located at the south part of town. So much things to do, here families usually visit the park the weekends where they can play pretty much any kind of sport. Also the park count with to lakes, three theaters.

149286375.name: Una placentera caminata en un parque dentro de la ciudad
149286375.author: a TripAdvisor user
149286375.reviewBody: This is the amazing park in the middle of the city, you can walk, run, skit or use your bicycle to spend a nice time, it has a museum, water park, and the space to practice several sports with different areas. Also ir has some animals free that you can touch ans enjoy.  I spent a good time there.

148848610.name: Big park makes for big fun
148848610.author: a TripAdvisor user
148848610.reviewBody: Lots to do, see, places to run and hang out.  We enjoyed all the different areas - the plane theater, arts center, science museum building, and the playground equipment is good. Good active park.

131370618.name: The best park in town
131370618.author: a TripAdvisor user
131370618.reviewBody: Simply put: the best park in town, lots of green spaces, very well taken care of and it is FREE!\nI cannot help but laugh whe I saw another reviewer call it "a medium sized park"; for a comparison the central park in NY has an area of 341 Ha (843 ac) and the Tangamanga park extends over 411 Ha (1015 ac). Considering that, I would say it is a rather big park.

130417876.name: Park
130417876.author: a TripAdvisor user
130417876.reviewBody: The best park in town, with m\u00faltiple activities. (observatory, childrens museum, water park, baseball and soccer fields, etc...)

127343293.name: Good for a weekend run
127343293.author: a TripAdvisor user
127343293.reviewBody: It must be one of the best places in SLP for a good run

126997264.name: Same old
126997264.author: a TripAdvisor user
126997264.reviewBody: A medium sized park that\'s well taken care off. Offers lots of ways to spend quality time with loved ones.

125204594.name: great park
125204594.author: a TripAdvisor user
125204594.reviewBody: Parque Tangamanga is a huge park in the middle of the city of San Luis Potosi. The entrance is free and you can have a barbecue, walk, run, visit the museum, the planetaium, the pools, some of this attaractions have a fee. It\'s clean and organize , a safe park!

1030406.name: exelent experiece!!
1030406.author: a TripAdvisor user
1030406.reviewBody: The Tangamanga park is a huge and wonderful experience that any body can have. And there is not only one but two of them. You can do anythig in those parks from, mountain biking, play basquet ball, soccer, even flight one of those scale airplanes. The experience is out of this world, and probably you would need more than one day to see everything in the park.A nd the best part is that, is free, no charge to get into the park. I really recomend to any body who is planing a visit to San Luis Potosi, to go visit those parks.

671244742.name: Fun inexpensive experience!
671244742.author: a TripAdvisor user
671244742.reviewBody: I am thankful that this museum has translations into English otherwise it would have been a quick walk through of looking at masks without knowing the history.  20 pesos for entry so it was well worth it!

itemReviewed.name: National Museum of Regional Masks (Museo Nacional de la Mascara)

668186516.name: Exotic collection of masks
668186516.author: a TripAdvisor user
668186516.reviewBody: A nice, fascinating collection of masks in Mexican culture (pre-hispanic and under Spanish influence). The museum is housed in a beautiful old European-style mansion. It isn\'t large, and you should be able to complete viewing the exhibits in about 1 or 1.5 hours (i.e., not overwhelming). There is some English signage (but it is limited, which is still an improvement over other museums in San Luis Potosi). The entry fee is only 20 pesos (+ 10 pesos if you want to take photos, even if its with your phone). If you\'re a tourist / foreigner visiting San Luis Potosi, this museum is one you should not miss (how often do you encounter museums focused on masks?).

itemReviewed.name: National Museum of Regional Masks (Museo Nacional de la Mascara)

662294443.name: The extra darkness doesn\u2019t add to the cachet
662294443.author: a TripAdvisor user
662294443.reviewBody:
I understand that light is the enemy of old artwork as it fades and weakens each piece but some museums take that a bit too far and trying to make out a dark brown mask hanging on a black background, in a dark room can get a bit daunting.  There are ways to light things up without damaging the cherished items and this museum could use some help in that regard.  

Love the overall concept but in many cases it felt like pieces were missing or missing information (always seemed to happen to the ones you really want to know more about).  I didn’t see dates on any of the masks but they came from eight Mexican States, as well as some from Africa, India, and Europe.  

Mostly ceremonial in nature, they cover anything from religion to carnival, fighting forces between European and indigenous beliefs and from dance to theater.  

There is a room full of small colorful and whimsical skeletons attending to everyday life things such as cooking, fishing, or weaving.  

The museum is more than 35 years old.  

Free on Tuesdays.

itemReviewed.name: National Museum of Regional Masks (Museo Nacional de la Mascara)

659391430.name: Beautiful ciollection of masks
659391430.author: a TripAdvisor user
659391430.reviewBody:
Centrally located in a magnificent old mansion.
Small but wonderful collection of Mexican masks and a small selection of International masks.
Highly recommended.
Some captions also in English.

itemReviewed.name: National Museum of Regional Masks (Museo Nacional de la Mascara)

659086685.name: Interesting building and Museum
659086685.author: a TripAdvisor user
659086685.reviewBody: This is near the El Carmen Church and the Theatre, so very central.  it is in a splendid late 19th house, which was built for a wealthy local family.  The objects are very well displayed, and even if you are not fascinated by masks, there is an international selection on display, which is thought provoking and interesting.

itemReviewed.name: National Museum of Regional Masks (Museo Nacional de la Mascara)

653577197.name: Interesting collection
653577197.author: a TripAdvisor user
653577197.reviewBody: I enjoyed this museum.  Good write ups about the masks, in a lovely building.  Admission is next to nothing.   Make sure to visit.   I liked it much more than the one in Zacatecas.

itemReviewed.name: National Museum of Regional Masks (Museo Nacional de la Mascara)

638217768.name: Interesting but small display
638217768.author: a TripAdvisor user
638217768.reviewBody: It\'s the first museum of this kind that I visit and the general thematics intrigued me. The museum is located in a nice colonial building. It is actually quite interesting and the explanations were plentiful (but mostly in Spanish.. A few only were in English). Since I speak Spanish, that wasn\'t an issue for me and I found the info really interesting. People not speaking Spanish might want to consider having someone with them that is able to translate. However, I thought the museum in itself was quite small and we were through after about 1 hour. Also probably  not the most interesting place to be for kids (except if it\'s a topic they are interested in).

itemReviewed.name: National Museum of Regional Masks (Museo Nacional de la Mascara)

631483262.name: One of the main masks\' collections in the world
631483262.author: a TripAdvisor user
631483262.reviewBody: Masks are a particular cultural way of life approach, and many cultures share this type of appearance. The combination of ancient cultures from Mexico with Spanish and religious new traditions brought to an incredible legacy. This museum has a very complete collection of masks of all the country, used for different purposes and festivities: carnivals, special saints and many more. If you like this kind of elements of culture, please come.

itemReviewed.name: National Museum of Regional Masks (Museo Nacional de la Mascara)

598327481.name: Must visit if you visit San Luis Potosi
598327481.author: a TripAdvisor user
598327481.reviewBody: The museum is in a beautiful building, the masks are from different parts of Mexico and there are some from other countries too. Great experience.

itemReviewed.name: National Museum of Regional Masks (Museo Nacional de la Mascara)

559880558.name: Great
559880558.author: a TripAdvisor user
559880558.reviewBody: This is a great museum housed in a beautiful old mansion. Lots of masks, many from other countries. Cost is 20 pesos, which is nothing.  Well worth a visit.

itemReviewed.name: National Museum of Regional Masks (Museo Nacional de la Mascara)

560070841.name: Great
560070841.author: a TripAdvisor user
560070841.reviewBody: This is a great Plaza with several museums, churches, restaurants, bars, and handicraft stores and stalls. There is a small park in which to sit and relax, and the entire area is free of vehicles. Especially beautiful at night. Do not miss.

539318080.name: Not bad
539318080.author: a TripAdvisor user
539318080.reviewBody: There is some interesting architecture around the plaza but its not a typical plaza where its nice to hang out and relax.  If you are walking the main street you will definitely walk by it.

504175886.name: Plaza de Aranzazu visit
504175886.author: a TripAdvisor user
504175886.reviewBody: This is a must see landmark in the heart of the old downtown, the vibrant color, the history and architecture go back in time over 500 years.

355821575.name: PAST AND PRESENT JOIN IN ONE PLACE!!
355821575.author: a TripAdvisor user
355821575.reviewBody: This is an iconic plaza in San Luis Potosi, On the right side you have Convent of San Francisco and facing front the stables of the whole complex. Those stables are now a beautiful museum,

262759659.name: Decent plaza ... very quaint ... quieter than some of the other plazas in SLP!
262759659.author: a TripAdvisor user
262759659.reviewBody: Decent plaza ... very quaint ... quieter than some of the other plazas in SLP! Although at the same time it is not as impressive either ... good place to sit down and rest a bit though!

233818117.name: TA overrated
233818117.author: a TripAdvisor user
233818117.reviewBody: This plaza, while perfectly acceptable, is by far from being SLP\'s best, imho. It\'s other plazas are full of life, this one was not.

215963268.name: Very Romantic
215963268.author: a TripAdvisor user
215963268.reviewBody: This park is what photo ops were meant for: the fountain, the quaint little street, the Romanesque archways, the Neo-Classical museum - It\'s all there

569959321.name: Nice for either an afternoon or night out.
569959321.author: a TripAdvisor user
569959321.reviewBody: The plaza is very big, there\'s a Church, a Museum, and a Teather. There\'s a lot of little craft shops, ice cream parlor, plus the street vendors. It\'s fairly clean and safe.

560042118.name: v
560042118.author: a TripAdvisor user
560042118.reviewBody: An excellent place, a very nice church, a historic place and with excellent finishes, an old and well preserved place, a very nice place.

539112269.name: Nice and tranquil
539112269.author: a TripAdvisor user
539112269.reviewBody: Very beautiful and tranquil plaza. Nice for a afternoon stroll. It has churches and live music sometimes as well. Great places to take pictures and admire the architecture.

441260129.name: A Place to Get Goosebumps- The Good Kind
441260129.author: a TripAdvisor user
441260129.reviewBody: I have visited the Plaza del Carmen and the church and looked at the amazing whole of the vista many times over the last seven years. It isn\'t the beautiful courtyard in front, it isn\'t the chillingly ornate facade , it isn\'t the church itself. It is the whole of the spectacle. This place is a World Heritage Site for a reason.  I\'m not a superstitious guy , and that includes religion, but this place moves me.

367500618.name: Quaint ol Mexico
367500618.author: a TripAdvisor user
367500618.reviewBody: I really enjoy walking in Downtown San Luis Potos\u00ed,  it gives you a full picture of the history of old Mexico,  there are many plazas that are in walking distance. We went down on a Saturday afternoon, there were weddings everywhere.  It was quite a sight to see.

359563918.name: I served in this church
359563918.author: a TripAdvisor user
359563918.reviewBody: This church holds the prosecion del  silencio every year. Beautifully capilla. Many campanas interest place to visit

335530309.name: Fiesta de Luz \u201cCarmelight 2015\u201d
335530309.author: a TripAdvisor user
335530309.reviewBody: We came to see the show since everyone was saying how awesome it was and the lights show was breathtaking. It was so colorful and festive. I loved how interactive it was and how it brought some of Mexico\'s history into the show.

332052303.name: Central plaza with surrounding attractions
332052303.author: a TripAdvisor user
332052303.reviewBody: Plaza del Carmen is a favorite among locals and visitors. It\'s surrounded by 2 historical museums, the regional mask museum, the Teatro de la Paz theater, blocks of stores for shopping, small restaurants,  government buildings, cathedrals, street vendors,  and tour  information. \n   The plaza is wide and well-maintained with a dramatic fountain in the center. It is a favorite place of congregation throughout the year; a relaxed environment to stroll, eat an ice cream, or people-watch. It is safe and well-lit at night. \nEnjoy San Luis!

277650128.name: Wonderful Plaza
277650128.author: a TripAdvisor user
277650128.reviewBody: The best plaza in SLP for people watching or hanging out.  In the afternoons there are usually free performances from Comics, Mimes, or Musical groups.  It has a fair like atmosphere with ice cream vendors and balloons.  There are a couple of restaurants nearby.  The pizza place (don\'t go for the pizza) is ok for some nachos and a couple of cheap beers with a fantastic view of the plaza.  In the late afternoons if you walk around the North side of the plaza and head East towards the Alameda there are some stands selling Authentic Enchiladas Potosinas and Tacos Rojos that are out of this world!

243055252.name: Churrigueresque at all its splendor!
243055252.author: a TripAdvisor user
243055252.reviewBody:
I was surprised to notice that there are no reviews on The Iglesia del Carmen. 

Located at the Plaza del Carmen, this church is an amazing display of Churrigueresque style. 

If you think baroque is elaborated, come inside and change your mind!

674494784.name: Nice exterior
674494784.author: a TripAdvisor user
674494784.reviewBody: Nice exterior looking out on the bustling, attractive Plaza de Armas; unremarkable interior but certainly worth a look.

665534956.name: Beautiful cathedral in a great city.
665534956.author: a TripAdvisor user
665534956.reviewBody: A very good friend of mine has taught English the last 3 years in San Luis Potosi. I finally got to visit there last year and I loved the city of SLP. The cathedral was gorgeous. A must see while in SLP! I was there in late March and early April of 2018, but those months were not offered in the drop down months below.

659082363.name: Good facade in the main square
659082363.author: a TripAdvisor user
659082363.reviewBody: This has a lovely facade, but the interior is less impressive, as it is rather a mish mash of styles and  eras..  Still, it\u2019s certainly worth seeing.

650756145.name: Visit at Christmas time - or any time of the year.
650756145.author: a TripAdvisor user
650756145.reviewBody: I have visited the Cathedral many times over the years.  It is a beautiful baroque building with a fabulous surrounding plaza.  I like going there at Christmas time when musical groups are signing in the plaza.  We happened to go to the Cathedral in the evening when a wonderful children\'s choir was performing hymns in Latin and Spanish.  It gives me goose bumps to think about it today.

646077189.name: Nice church to see. Has a light show at nights.
646077189.author: a TripAdvisor user
646077189.reviewBody: It\'s located in a nice downtown area. It has parking places nearby. You can walk from there to many other things.

634285398.name: Beautiful
634285398.author: a TripAdvisor user
634285398.reviewBody: Make your way to the downtown area. Several beautiful churches. Great area to walk around. Quick Uber ride from hotel

619260678.name: Beautiful
619260678.author: a TripAdvisor user
619260678.reviewBody: The cathedral is beautiful, with lots of barroque art and nooks to explore. I recommend you check out the mass scheduling, so that you can really walk and look around. If there is mass, it is generally suggested to tourists that they do not walk around out of respect.

617104034.name: Our Mexican Heritage
617104034.author: a TripAdvisor user
617104034.reviewBody: A beautiful cathedral with history, soul and tradition. During Christmas time you must visit the night show.

578637283.name: beautiful cathedral, well preserved.
578637283.author: a TripAdvisor user
578637283.reviewBody: alot of people walking around the catherdral, no issues with security. felt safe walking around enjoying the view.

576069659.name: Required stop
576069659.author: a TripAdvisor user
576069659.reviewBody: Although it is like walking into most Chatolic catedrals around the world, it is well worth the visit as part of a downtown tour of the Historic Center. A recently finished restauration gives it a better look of its original construction.

565180290.name: OMG
565180290.author: a TripAdvisor user
565180290.reviewBody: If in SLP you must make the time to visit. The 24 apostles statues were incredible. The inside architecture is like so many others in Mexico. The best in the world.

564590748.name: Beautiful building
564590748.author: a TripAdvisor user
564590748.reviewBody: You can see a beautiful building with a really interesting history, If you visit SLP, yuo must know it and ask about towers, apostles and clock

556177402.name: What can you say, its BEATIFUL
556177402.author: a TripAdvisor user
556177402.reviewBody: Very nice, cathedral although some claim San Francisco\'s is better in SLP. I didn\'t get to make it. But this one IS great and has a lot to do around it and often has a variety of free entertainment.

539311418.name: Very nice
539311418.author: a TripAdvisor user
539311418.reviewBody: Great architecture and the inside is stunning.  I would highly recommend if you are visiting SLP.  This is just one of the many nice things to see in the city.

521815517.name: Amazing
521815517.author: a TripAdvisor user
521815517.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful Cathedrals in M\u00e9xico, you should visit San Luis and the fantastic downtown including of course the Cathedral.

514354600.name: Beautiful ceremony!
514354600.author: a TripAdvisor user
514354600.reviewBody: Came here for a wedding and it was absolutely gorgeous. Even if someone was just visiting, this is a great cathedral to see.

513968666.name: Beautiful
513968666.author: a TripAdvisor user
513968666.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral outside and inside! The cathedral is very beautiful to look at from far and close.

510247925.name: The cathedral of the 24 apostles.
510247925.author: a TripAdvisor user
510247925.reviewBody: San Luis Potosi has a beautiful cathedral with a very particular history since it has 24 sculptures of the apostles. The first 12 made in pink quarry and the 12 later ordered to be made in Carrara Marble and sculpted by the Biagi brothers, the Marble sculptures are replicas of those found inside the Basilica of St. John Lateran in Rome.

500277243.name: Must see
500277243.author: a TripAdvisor user
500277243.reviewBody: Enjoy the architecture and beauty of this church and city.   Visiting a church which has a rich centuries old history is fascinating.

498083603.name: nice cathedral,very busy in plaza on sunday
498083603.author: a TripAdvisor user
498083603.reviewBody: Very busy in plaza on sunday all day, it was still packed at 930pm when I left. Parking was a definite challenge though.

493384036.name: My own home town. Cathedral
493384036.author: a TripAdvisor user
493384036.reviewBody: The cathedral always have ongoing catholic services. Everyday \nSince in the center of the city always bright and beautiful \nDo not miss it.

482455236.name: Beautiful cathedral
482455236.author: a TripAdvisor user
482455236.reviewBody: We were lucky enough to be able to see a wedding and attend the mass. Stunning everywhere you looked!  Be sure to walk around (when there is not a mass) and enjoy the sculptures and stations.

482194963.name: Stunning
482194963.author: a TripAdvisor user
482194963.reviewBody: Currently in the process of restoring the exterior of this cathedral to its former glory, (hundreds of years of dirt and grime take its toll). One tower is complete, the matching tower is still grey and dirty. Absolutely awestruck by the detail of the exterior and interior. If you don\'t visit the old city in Plaza de la Almas, and see all the historic buildings at least once in your trip to SLP, you\'re missing out.

477129238.name: Beautiful..
477129238.author: a TripAdvisor user
477129238.reviewBody: It\'s big and well decorated. Amazing and must place to see if you are in San Luis potosi. It shows European architecture beautifully .. well crafted..

475668872.name: It is really magestic!
475668872.author: a TripAdvisor user
475668872.reviewBody: Cathedral is amazin. So,e carhedrals looksthe same but This one is really wonderfull! Impressive ceiling and dexoration.

474845003.name: Festival of Light was magical
474845003.author: a TripAdvisor user
474845003.reviewBody: Visited cathedral in the day and was so impressed with the facade but seeing it lit up at night was magical.....

469383080.name: Enam\u00f3rate de San Luis Potos\u00ed
469383080.author: a TripAdvisor user
469383080.reviewBody: Omg. What a beautiful place to go. I really can\'t wait to go back. This plaza make me feel amazing. Good Vibes.

462270155.name: BEAUTIFUL!
462270155.author: a TripAdvisor user
462270155.reviewBody: The city\u00b4s Cathedral is a marvelous sample of the baroque style.  Located at the corner in front of the Plaza de Armas.  At its facade, you can appreciate the beautiful marble sculptures of the twelve Apostles.  The two lateral towers that complement the whole front of the church, give an exquisite site as you enter.  At the interior there is so much to appreciate, floors, ceilings, altars, everything is beautiful and with so many details.  A must if you\u00b4re in San Luis.

456554726.name: beautiful cathedral
456554726.author: a TripAdvisor user
456554726.reviewBody: this is a place loated in historic downtown, with barroco and neoclasi style, build in 1670 made all in pink stone (cantera)

453117118.name: Which tower is new?
453117118.author: a TripAdvisor user
453117118.reviewBody: To be a cathedral in mexico you need two spires/towers so originally it only had one. So you need to guess which one is new. Having done that the answer is the other one (trust me). Anyway,  externally and internally it\'s quite impressive however if you visit virtually any historic church in Mexico you will see as good or better. Worth visiting if you are in down town slp (especially during light shows) but don\'t make a special trip.

449435548.name: Beautiful Cathedral
449435548.author: a TripAdvisor user
449435548.reviewBody: I loved this Cathedral! I had no expectations whatsoever, , but it is one  of my favourites. It has very high ceilings painted in software blue inside with angels and saints. Outside it has two different coloured towers as they were made at different times with different materials.

424180703.name: Its a cathedral
424180703.author: a TripAdvisor user
424180703.reviewBody: It is ok. Nothing really special as cathedrals go. But when visiting slp it is worth a few minutes inside.

406407101.name: Beautiful facade, could not stop watching it!
406407101.author: a TripAdvisor user
406407101.reviewBody: this Cathedral is at the end of the Zaragosa walking corridor.  The Facade captivated me.  Kept taking pictures of it.  Really amazing.  It is going through an outside renovation, the 2 towers are surrounded by mesh and they are cleaning it.  Inside amazing statues and ceilings.  In the corner you will always see the tuna players or some kind of music from the local stage.  Really a great place to visit.

402082820.name: Recommended for the history and architecture.
402082820.author: a TripAdvisor user
402082820.reviewBody: Beautifully renovated church. Nice stop for the historic, architectural person. My teen was not into it but she enjoyed sitting outside plaza and people watching. Late eveings until 930ish this place is alive, there was a mariachi group one night, another night there was a wedding. Beautiful. If you\'re staying near i would recommend visiting more than once as every night is different. Weekend especially.

392924539.name: Reflects the local culture
392924539.author: a TripAdvisor user
392924539.reviewBody: It\'s a very old church and looks magnificent.\nVery interesting to see the Spanish design and the art work from Mexico combined together.

391522025.name: A very old cathefral from the 1600\'s, before the U.S. defeat of the British.!!
391522025.author: a TripAdvisor user
391522025.reviewBody: This is  truly a memorable experience to visit a 400 year old cathedral. It is in the main square of San Luis Potosi where there are additional things to see and places to shop.  Don\'t miss having something to eat at the many restaurants and coffee shops.

385005866.name: Great sculptures
385005866.author: a TripAdvisor user
385005866.reviewBody: If you like marble statues, this is the place in SLP.  Lots of statuary inside and out and hold your visual interest.  My favorite church in town.

380564129.name: Gorgeous town center
380564129.author: a TripAdvisor user
380564129.reviewBody: I visited the town center as soon as I arrived. It was close to sunset and all the churches and the local theatre we bustling with  the local people enjoying their own city.  The churches., especially in the light of day end were absolutely beautiful and very well maintained

370245169.name: Beautiful church
370245169.author: a TripAdvisor user
370245169.reviewBody: Amazing construction in the downtown of the city. A lot of people visiting, the church is not just a church is an amazing and old building.

361324320.name: Great place!
361324320.author: a TripAdvisor user
361324320.reviewBody: IT is a beautiful baroque church, one of the oldest in the A,Erica\'s continent. I attended mass, and it was amazing to be in such a beautiful temple.

358104427.name: Highlight of every sightseeing tour
358104427.author: a TripAdvisor user
358104427.reviewBody: A must for everyone visting this underated City of San Luis Potosi. Combine ir with a nice stroll through the historic part of town.

349398059.name: fascinating architecture
349398059.author: a TripAdvisor user
349398059.reviewBody: I was impressed by the ceremony , not mention people praying, sharing goods. I was there dias de los muertos and I saw those chatolic altars alo astek influences in ceremonies.

336747994.name: Beautiful
336747994.author: a TripAdvisor user
336747994.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful ever, inside and out. A must see attraction. We are not really church people but this one was not to missed.

335537291.name: Beautiful Cathedral
335537291.author: a TripAdvisor user
335537291.reviewBody: The cathedral is like a pink salmon color that makes it very unique compared to other cathedrals. It is perfect to take pictures of and stare at the cathedral.

314998142.name: San ;Luis\'s main "pink" cathedral.
314998142.author: a TripAdvisor user
314998142.reviewBody: I\'ve seen churches of any color around Mexico, but I can\'t remember of any other one with the same orangish-pinkish color of San Luis\'s main church. And since the colour can easily be stained, they also covered the two main belltowers with some huge webs to prevent pigeons from staining it too much. The style of the churck is interesting and deserves several pictures, and also its inside is interesting, although not clear enough, unless you visit it in the middle of a very sunny day, when enough light comes through its upper windows. Avoid going there during mass hours, as the crowd will probably not allow you to enjoy all the artistically-interesting corners of this church.

305550218.name: Great for walking at evening or night.
305550218.author: a TripAdvisor user
305550218.reviewBody: Great for visiting at night in weekends most of downtown area turns into pedestrian area and streets are closed. Lots of places to see.

304106325.name: Tumal Waterfall
304106325.author: a TripAdvisor user
304106325.reviewBody: This is an adventure that I would highly recommend seeing. It is a bit tough to find however once you arrive the trip will be well worth it. It is a beautiful walk along the river  to the top of the fall. Then down a few ladders to the base of the falls. So beautiful!!!

292942007.name: Don\'t forget to look up
292942007.author: a TripAdvisor user
292942007.reviewBody: This cathedral is the most beautiful church/cathedral in the city. The best part is definitely the ceiling which is painted in a way it feels like looking up the sky.\n\nLots of details on walls, ceiling and pillars. Just be aware that the cathedral is closed during some hours, so if it\'s closed, just come back later.

285780898.name: Cathedral at night
285780898.author: a TripAdvisor user
285780898.reviewBody: A beautiful place to visit at night, it\'s a colonial city with a lot of places to discover. It\'s a magic city.

268009016.name: Beautiful
268009016.author: a TripAdvisor user
268009016.reviewBody: Loved everything about this beautiful place.  The church bells were awesome to.   The pictures here do not quite do it justice.

262758781.name: Impressive Cathedral ... I really liked the blue painted ceilings!
262758781.author: a TripAdvisor user
262758781.reviewBody: Impressive Cathedral ... I really liked the blue painted ceilings!\n\nIt was impressive to be inside during a full-blown Lent Mass!

254675982.name: Beautiful
254675982.author: a TripAdvisor user
254675982.reviewBody: Lovely, beautiful ornate cathedral. Church is open to public and worth going in for a look at the wonderful art, ornate carvings. also a cool place to sit and pray or contemplate

250931709.name: Hermosa es la catedral de SLP
250931709.author: a TripAdvisor user
250931709.reviewBody: I was there by Christmas season and loved the light show at the Cathedral, I have never seen something like it, it was wonderful. The city is just beautiful, I took a bus tour and loved it. The historic downtown displays a great mixture of different artistic styles in many buildings and it\'s a major example of colonial architecture in Mexico

245859869.name: Beautiful place
245859869.author: a TripAdvisor user
245859869.reviewBody: Superb architectural future, inside the Cathedral you can discover  many art future during my visit we could see the nativity display.

243056164.name: 24 Apostles Church
243056164.author: a TripAdvisor user
243056164.reviewBody:
Loved the fact that both towers are from different cantera stone colors. The inside of this church is beautiful, but very simple compared to the Iglesia Del Carmen

This is the only church in the world that has 24 apostles, must see and ask about the story

230423997.name: Recovering Catholic.....
230423997.author: a TripAdvisor user
230423997.reviewBody: I am an ex-Roman Catholic, USA style, but still enjoy visiting Catholic churches to see South and Central Americans practicing their religion. My experience here was unique in that numerous people came up to me and hugged me, no doubt the only gringo around. It was most touching.

228852943.name: Old nice catheral
228852943.author: a TripAdvisor user
228852943.reviewBody: Should see the inside one of the nicest one in SLP. Like the old feel of the church. A must see when in the city.

228074353.name: Beautiful place!
228074353.author: a TripAdvisor user
228074353.reviewBody: The Cathedral is located in the middle of downtown with a few other churches surrounding it. It was a great place to visit and hear a little of the history of San Luis Potosi.

221590260.name: Awesome
221590260.author: a TripAdvisor user
221590260.reviewBody: This was one of many of the amazing churchs that we visted here in Mexico. We always visit Churchs snd Mexico has many to see. It\'s hard to say if Mexico or Europe has the most historical churches, must go see for your self

218067877.name: lovely!
218067877.author: a TripAdvisor user
218067877.reviewBody: We visited the Cathedral in San Luis Potosi City a couple of weeks ago.  The Cathedral is located in the city.  The city is busy with lot\'s of citizens and cars.  There are lot\'s of businesses and activity going on as you would expect in a major city.  The Cathedral is located right in the middle of all this madness.  The Cathedral is beautiful outside and inside. It\'s huge!!! In fact, it\'s very challenging to capture a complete picture because of it\'s size.  Whenever I visit a new city, I love to visit the local Catholic Church.  Words can not express the beauty of the cathedral.  There was a service taking place and made it difficult to take pictures inside. I was able to go in and say the prayers that needed to be said. AMAZING EXPERIENCE!!!!

215963628.name: Grand
215963628.author: a TripAdvisor user
215963628.reviewBody: You can\'t miss this cathedral in San Luis Potos\u00ed - It\'s impressive architecture stands on on a busy square - It just begs to be photographed :)

209415220.name: Original old Cathedral
209415220.author: a TripAdvisor user
209415220.reviewBody: Quite old cathedral, some of the first buildings are from the first Spanish settelements in San Luis in the 15th hundreds..nice

201968328.name: do not miss it
201968328.author: a TripAdvisor user
201968328.reviewBody: It is one of the most beautiful mexican cathedrals. Try to go late afternoon when the sun lights the front. The colors are impressive.\nTry to go for the night illumination show. It is worth it.

192844434.name: Marvels of the past!
192844434.author: a TripAdvisor user
192844434.reviewBody: Looking at this Barroc cathedral makes you value the art of our ancestors,the detail and creativity, the ingenuity that  went into the making,simply amazing!

185974882.name: San Luis Potosi plaza tour
185974882.author: a TripAdvisor user
185974882.reviewBody: The artwork and inside is very nice. We visited the cathedral when touring the SLP plaza on a Sunday. lots of shops etc. there

185817548.name: historic down Town San Luis Potosi
185817548.author: a TripAdvisor user
185817548.reviewBody: The cathedral is one highlight of the visit of historical down town of SLP,\nthe plaza is verynice to hang out for a while, with a couple of caf\u00e9s and ice-cream shops sorrounding it.\nEnjoy.

183220245.name: Historical attraction, special place
183220245.author: a TripAdvisor user
183220245.reviewBody: My visit of the Cathedral was very strong.  The artwork and adornment inside has extreme detail.The longer I looked around the more little things I noticed.  Out of respect for the worshipers, I did not take any pictures inside, because it is a fully functional church.

170874623.name: Architecture and history
170874623.author: a TripAdvisor user
170874623.reviewBody: I really liked this place, my friends and I visited it just to fulfill the obligated visit to this place, but once you are inside the Cathedral, the roof is gorgeous, it\'s painted as the shroud of the Virgin Mary, with a cerulean blue and golden stars.\nRight outside of the main entrance, there is a streetcar which takes you to he most interesting places of the historic downtown.\nIt\'s worth to hop on it  if you want to avoid the sun... :)

150427763.name: A magical place
150427763.author: a TripAdvisor user
150427763.reviewBody: San Luis Potos\u00ed is a colonial city one of the first cities founded by the Spanish conquistadores. It\'s well know for their silver and gold mines with allot of places to get a good deals for fine jewelry. I recommend downtown which has the cheaper and biggest silver and gold mall. Right at the hearth of town is called centro joyero.

149286734.name: This is a traditional church with amazing night lights
149286734.author: a TripAdvisor user
149286734.reviewBody: I like the barroc style, full of the Mexican traditions, You can see the pictures of the saints and the figures with the half of century of traditions. In the night it has special lightening that make it special, it looks great

148848689.name: Beautiful architecture and feel
148848689.author: a TripAdvisor user
148848689.reviewBody: We didn\'t want to interrupt the mass going on too much, so we stayed to the back and sides.  It is so nice and they have done a great job of the upkeep.  Especially nice at Christmas when the nativities are set up.

136437229.name: Beautiful!
136437229.author: a TripAdvisor user
136437229.reviewBody: I went during the lighting at night and it was very nice! Many people go and there are so many attractions such as mimes and clowns. There are so many more historic venues around there such as museums also.

130980898.name: barroc jewel restored
130980898.author: a TripAdvisor user
130980898.reviewBody: the last time I went to San Luis Potos\u00ed I found that all the cables had been removed around the Cathedral and it had been restored.  It is a pleasure

124556876.name: Beautiful
124556876.author: a TripAdvisor user
124556876.reviewBody: This is a fantastically ornate cathedral and well worth the visit.  The outside is lovely, but the inside is better.

122649907.name: Amazing light show
122649907.author: a TripAdvisor user
122649907.reviewBody: We were fortunate to be in the plaza on a Friday evening and were delighted to see the most amazing light and sound show on the facade of the cathedral.  I have never seen anything like it.  The facade morphs into various, colorful images that has to be seen to understand.  Also, the cathedral of course is gourgeous and has a very nice gift shop for those inclined.

115164811.name: very beautifull
115164811.author: a TripAdvisor user
115164811.reviewBody: this is very nice attraciton, totaly worth looking at the different catholic churches

659100506.name: Building better than the Museum itself.
659100506.author: a TripAdvisor user
659100506.reviewBody: This is not a must go to Museum, but then I am not a great rail enthusiast, however it is in a wonderful building, both inside and out, and for that alone worth a visit.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Del Ferrocarril Jesus Garcia Corona

address.streetAddress: Chicosein S/N Cruz Con Manuel Jose Othon Centro Historico

604463922.name: A step back in time.
604463922.author: a TripAdvisor user
604463922.reviewBody: I was very pleasantly surprised by the Railroad Museum in downtown San Luis Potos\u00ed. It is located in the old railroad terminal. It gives a very detailed history with photographs,video and old passenger cars that were in service many years ago.  There is also an outside exhibit that is more hands on and great for photos.  I was in the terminal 30 years ago when it was still a functioning terminal.  Plans are afoot to reopen the route from San Luis Potos\u00ed to Tampico in the near future for tourism.  There is an art museum, cafeteria and souvenir shop in the terminal.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Del Ferrocarril Jesus Garcia Corona

583177922.name: Enjoy time at Train Museum
583177922.author: a TripAdvisor user
583177922.reviewBody: This place was good time at Train Museum,San Luis Potosi even it was not big to my expectation.\nI could see some diesel locomotives had been operated around 50 years ago in Mexico..Awsome diorama to show nice scenery around railway and staion in San Luis Potosi was empressive.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Del Ferrocarril Jesus Garcia Corona

address.streetAddress: Chicosein S/N Cruz Con Manuel Jose Othon Centro Historico

559881171.name: Good
559881171.author: a TripAdvisor user
559881171.reviewBody: Very nice little museum with a lot of pictures and displays from the past. You can also walk through several passenger cars and a very old sleeping car. Interesting. Also has a model train display which looks a little shabby. Toy train as well; don\u2019t know if it runs or not but the tracks are there.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Del Ferrocarril Jesus Garcia Corona

510204674.name: Great experience
510204674.author: a TripAdvisor user
510204674.reviewBody: if you want to learn more about the history of the train in Mexico and how at some pont this was the main transportation in Mexico, this is the place.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Del Ferrocarril Jesus Garcia Corona

488905424.name: Decent railway collection
488905424.author: a TripAdvisor user

475669566.author: a TripAdvisor user

itemReviewed.name: Museo Del Ferrocarril Jesus Garcia Corona

451020614.name: Visit it!
451020614.author: a TripAdvisor user
451020614.reviewBody: it\'s a really amazing place, especially for the youngest who never saw a train closely. When you step in a wagon it\'s looks like a jump in the past!

itemReviewed.name: Museo Del Ferrocarril Jesus Garcia Corona

414880077.name: Old trains that you can get on
414880077.author: a TripAdvisor user
414880077.reviewBody: Average place, is nice to go and visit only if you find nothing better to do, or if there is an special event... or if you are really interested in trains.\n\nThe highlight of the place are the trains they have where you can get on and see how it was when there were passenger trains in Mexico.  Specially if you go with kids.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Del Ferrocarril Jesus Garcia Corona
