409062791.name: Interesting place if you are into trains
409062791.author: a TripAdvisor user
409062791.reviewBody: This is an one of kind museum, solely based on Mexican railroad history, the have some passenger cars and a few historical items. There is a big HO model train layout

itemReviewed.name: Museo Del Ferrocarril Jesus Garcia Corona

address.streetAddress: Chicosein S/N Cruz Con Manuel Jose Othon Centro Historico

664309957.name: awesome sacred spot
664309957.author: a TripAdvisor user
664309957.reviewBody: both the exterior and the interior are exceptional examples of the combination of european building techniques and local indigenous aesthetics.  the all gold chapel to the left of the altar is priceless.  the jacaranda trees in front of the historic theatre\'s colorful dome are spectacular in spring

659110330.name: Stunning church, one of the best things to see in SLP
659110330.author: a TripAdvisor user
659110330.reviewBody: One of the many highlights of San Luis, a jaw dropping-ly wonderful building both inside and out, you should not miss this, especially if you like Mexican Baroque and the Churrigueresco.  It is closed in the early afternoon, but opens again at 16.00.  Don\u2019t miss the camarin on the left hand side, and the entrance to the same.

385009228.name: A bit overrated
385009228.author: a TripAdvisor user
385009228.reviewBody: Easily the most popular church in town but the art is graphically violent and difficult to image venerating.  If you had to miss a church in town, I\'d pick this one.  Others have better art and more history.

292946328.name: Detailed church
292946328.author: a TripAdvisor user
292946328.reviewBody: This church is located at the Plaza del Carmen and is hard not to see when you go there. The church is full of details everywhere and the outside really lifts up the plaza from the outside.\n\nA must see when in SLP.

675548854.name: Amazing sculptures
675548854.author: a TripAdvisor user
675548854.reviewBody: Though not generally known, at least not in the US, Leonora Carrington was a gifted sculptor whose surrealistic pieces more than merit a traveler\u2019s attention. The collection is large and fascinating, amply displaying the artist\u2019s talent and imagination. The museum is located on the Calzada de Guadalupe, a pleasant stroll away from the center of San Luis.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Guadalupe 705 Centro de las Artes de San Luis Potosi Centenario

672251702.name: Don\'t miss this museum. Surrealistic Art.
672251702.author: a TripAdvisor user
672251702.reviewBody: This museum is a must see.  Its relatively new and the artist has ties to Salvador Dali and Edward James, the English King who had a sculpture garden in Xilitla, Mexico.  The Carrington Museum is on many bus routes so you can take a tour of the city while meeting native potosinos.  The main Cathedral is also close by, within walking distance.  Great Area of the city, very close to downtown, central area.\n

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Guadalupe 705 Centro de las Artes de San Luis Potosi Centenario

667601166.name: Great discovery
667601166.author: a TripAdvisor user
667601166.reviewBody: An amazing space, greatly curated. An excellent simple of her scultures. I would have liked to see some of her paintings as part of the collection.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Guadalupe 705 Centro de las Artes de San Luis Potosi Centenario

662294009.name: Surreal location for surrealist artist
662294009.author: a TripAdvisor user
662294009.reviewBody:
Wow!  What an amazing way to cycle up part of an old jail!  Escapism seen in old cells where freedom no longer exist!  How brilliant.  

In the five main outdoor patios are five massive sculptures by Leonora Carrington.  Rather than being dwarfed by the huge yards and tall walls they are in, they add drama and dimension.  Inside old cells are paintings and drawings, (60 or so) bronze sculptures (60 or so), and silver jewel-like pieces (20 or so).  

Quotes from Leonora or people who knew her are on many walls.  A short documentary (in French with Spanish subtitles) plays in one room.  

They were preparing for the one year anniversary when I went so I didn’t get to see the whole place but what I saw was impressive and I think could only be done with the love and passion of her son, Pablo Weisz, who helped put this together (his work is found in two cells).  

This whole place speaks of fervor for everything in life.  

Free to anyone on Wednesdays.  

Don’t miss it or next door’s Centro de las Artes... which also has some sculptures dotting its landscape.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Guadalupe 705 Centro de las Artes de San Luis Potosi Centenario

658076052.name: Extraordinary art pieces in a great setting.
658076052.author: a TripAdvisor user
658076052.reviewBody: Amazing art. Perfect setting, given the fact that Leonora had been imprisoned. The building is an old jail.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Guadalupe 705 Centro de las Artes de San Luis Potosi Centenario

657861488.name: Amuseum in a former prison, now a cultural center. Must be seen
657861488.author: a TripAdvisor user
657861488.reviewBody: I expected a more plentiful exhibit, but what was shown was very interesting and dramatically exposed. Ms Carrington was a highly traveled and very inspiring woman who lived life to its fullest and created very dramatic sculptures that were avantgarde, in my opinion, and would fit right in to the Picasso world. Must see and the prison museum when visiting SLP

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Guadalupe 705 Centro de las Artes de San Luis Potosi Centenario

664309037.name: a great place to hang out
664309037.author: a TripAdvisor user
664309037.reviewBody: i felt safe alone there and enjoyed the friendly ambience.  lots of locals and mexican tourists, the double-decker tour buses are a don\'t miss if you speak spanish.  very scenic, even if you don\'t.

569979344.name: You can eat bugs there
569979344.author: a TripAdvisor user
569979344.reviewBody: It\'s a charming place, there are a lot of good restaurants nearby and you can sample crickets from a street vendor. It\'s also a reference point and some tours part from there.

539323727.name: Pretty good
539323727.author: a TripAdvisor user
539323727.reviewBody: Usually pretty busy with people milling about, occasional performances, and various snack vendors.  A few interesting buildings around and good for people watching.

472220201.name: Listening to a band
472220201.author: a TripAdvisor user
472220201.reviewBody: This plaza is the place for celebrations and impromptu functions such as the band raising funds to be able to attend a band contest in Mexico City. People are friendly and all are welcome.

643121920.name: Small, quaint
643121920.author: a TripAdvisor user
643121920.reviewBody: Nice little area of town to sit and enjoy quiet time - it is also a part of the sites explained on the turibus from the centro

512989015.name: Part of the heart of this city
512989015.author: a TripAdvisor user
512989015.reviewBody: One of the most amazing places in San Luis Potos\u00ed, having a lot of colonial churches, the place is quiet and beautiful, with a lot of life and very good restaurants that keep growing. It is definitely a must in this city and a wonderful experience walking trough the alley that connects this part with Aranzaz\u00fa Square.

475669364.name: Colonial wonder.
475669364.author: a TripAdvisor user
475669364.reviewBody: A cozy and very small plaza just around the corner from the cathedral. Nice restaurants and little bars serving tequila, mezcal and all kinds of cocktails.

419965302.name: Perhaps the pretiest
419965302.author: a TripAdvisor user
419965302.reviewBody: Of the many small (and large) parks in SLP, this is my favourite. Fountain and green-space surrounded by three churches: one Presbyterian). Great relaxing and people watching.

402743149.name: What a great gathering place!
402743149.author: a TripAdvisor user
402743149.reviewBody: A beautiful plaza and this the Church is amazingly beautiful.  You can see everyone walking, enjoying time with the family.  Cute shops and restaurants along the way.

355901500.name: A sample of the real Mexican Identity
355901500.author: a TripAdvisor user
355901500.reviewBody: This Plaza is a melting pot of what Mexicans have become. This Park has a religious name San Francisco, after one of the first religious congregationscthat arrive to Mexico and an official name Jardin Guerrero, after an Independence war hero. Around this Plaza you can see three churches, two catholics and o e protesant. There is also the building of the Culture Departmen, which used to be a housing complex back in the 70s.\nI recommend buying a cup with fresh fruit lemon, salt and chili at any of the local stalls and walk around admiring the Plaza.

292932582.name: Green plaza
292932582.author: a TripAdvisor user
292932582.reviewBody: This plaza is surrounded by a lot of beautiful buildings. There is also a lot of trees, bushes, flowers and grass.\n\nNot really worth stay at the plaza for a long period, but it\'s nice to walk around here and watch the buildings.

290250163.name: Disappointed
290250163.author: a TripAdvisor user
290250163.reviewBody: The buildings are beautiful. The city itself is quite dirty and there really is nothing to do. You can see this in 30 minutes. It\'s not exactly what I was expecting.

262759004.name: Nice plaza to stroll around ... cars not allowed access!!
262759004.author: a TripAdvisor user
262759004.reviewBody: Nice plaza to stroll around ... cars not allowed access!! It was wonderful to walk around it on a Sunday night!

249464290.name: Chillin\' at the Plaza
249464290.author: a TripAdvisor user
249464290.reviewBody: This is a most delightful, shady park full of greenery, benches, birds and quiet tranquility, after spending two hours walking, talking and shopping in the overactive center of San Luis Potos\u00ed, it is definitely the place to be. There is a centuries-old, giant fountain spewing liquid freshness and good "negative" ions high in the air, drawing children and wild doves like a magnet. Here young couples sit quietly holding hands, park cleaners silently sweep the grounds with large, rustic brooms and the hustle-bustle of the city melts away. There are two cart-stands on the street boundary, selling fresh, cut-up fruit in large acrylic cups, juice or pop in one, packaged food snacks in the other, and public bathrooms are available half a block down the Callej\u00f3n (alley) de San Francisco, at the opposite width-end. The park is about two city-blocks in length but only half across, it fronts the ancient Church of San Francisco and another (?), and is surrounded by beautifully renovated colonial buildings and residential housing dating back to the founding of this 17th century city. There is an excellent craft-market all the way down the Callej\u00f3n de S.F., right by the side of the church, with bar/restaurants, shops and boutiques across and, at the very end of the alley, a terrific night spot called La Piquer\u00eda Mescaler\u00eda, which specializes in Mescal cocktails, Pulque, live Blues, Jazz, and the absolute best bar-scene in San Luis. Do not miss this wonderful plaza and adjacent area.

233815641.name: Plaza???
233815641.author: a TripAdvisor user
233815641.reviewBody: I think it\'s really more accurate .to call this space Parque San Francisco, given that it\'s lawn and trees. Unusually large number of churches right there. Tranquil. Beware of lumpy lawn; I nearly lost an ankle to jt, and definitely lost my dignity! Museo Regional is a black away.

232832764.name: Nice little square
232832764.author: a TripAdvisor user
232832764.reviewBody: Very nice square in old downtown. There is a small garden, a fountain, some nice old buildings (colonial and baroque) and a beautiful catholic church (Templo de San Francisco) well worth the time if only for the architecture and the detailed religious statues and paintings found inside.  Coffee places and small restaurants can be found around and a museum (which used to be a convent) is located behind the church (in Plaza de Aranzazu). The place has a young and trendy atmosphere during weekends.

221584722.name: Lovers Park
221584722.author: a TripAdvisor user
221584722.reviewBody: Beauitful Park and with wonderful surounding Churches, so cute seeing all the couples in love and sitting intiately

209414960.name: You feel the atmosphere
209414960.author: a TripAdvisor user
209414960.reviewBody: A must see spot when in San Luis, you feel the old atmosphere on the square and the small streets around the square!!

189536553.name: The most relaxing plaza!
189536553.author: a TripAdvisor user
189536553.reviewBody: Just a great place to hang out by the fountain. Peaceful and serene.  Great family-run eateries spring up on the weekend.  A great pub is nearby (Oruga y La Cebada)!

185817247.name: down town San Luis Potos\u00ed
185817247.author: a TripAdvisor user
185817247.reviewBody:
very nice "plaza" , you can sit there and just watch people go by, listen to the birds, enjoy the sun tickeling your nose.
Get some freshly cut fruit, "natural", or con "chile and limón". 
very good :-)
than stroll along the alley, and have a look if you find something at the stands: Natives offering their Works, also "hippies" offering their hand-made jewlery.
Good Cafés, bistro's and Restaurants (la oruga : yummi), on the way.

126353476.name: beautiful
126353476.author: a TripAdvisor user
126353476.reviewBody: a great place to sit relax and enjoy this great plaza...Costanzo Candy store is a minute walk... best candy you ever had

124556941.name: Nice, but there is better in San Luis
124556941.author: a TripAdvisor user
124556941.reviewBody: It is not the best plaza, the church is nice, but that is really all.  The plaza itself is pretty forgettable. Go to the Plaza del Carmen and the Plaza de Armas.

623646278.name: A must see!
623646278.author: a TripAdvisor user
623646278.reviewBody:
The grutas are a definite must see if you find yourself in Rio Verde or in surrounding area.  However, plan wisely Although approximately 25 km east of Rio Verde, only a small portion of that is driving on a smooth paved road. About 80% of the drive will be on very curvy and narrow dirt road with spectaular views straight out of a National Geographic special! You will pass through tiny little pueblos dotted with big, happy cows that are far more interested in the lush vegetation than looking out for oncoming vehicles. But a gentle honk seems to do the trick. 
You will eventually arrive at a large gate next to a large sign informing individuals that you are arrived a state park. Go inside and pay a minimal entrance fee, and away you go. From that point the road becomes even bumpier due to runoff from previous rains but the natural beauty of this enchanted area makes for a fun adventure! Your car will have to cross a few streams before arriving at an obvious information center with a large parking field right in front of it (to the right). Therefore, drive a vehicle that can handle this kind of terrain. From the parking lot area, you will hike 2 more km until you reach the gruta entrance located left of the suspended bridge that connects visitors to eco-friendly restrooms (bring toilet paper and hand sanitizer).
The hike itself is pretty easy but not flat. You will have to cross 3 streams with beautifully clear and cold water no higher than mid calve. The road can be a little muddy but you can certainly role up a sturdy baby stroller. It is this part of the adventure where you may encounter many very small but colorful butterflies, grasshoppers and flowers. And yes, more well-feed cows! 
Keep in mind that you cannot bring strollers into the gruta. It is damp and dark inside, but surprisingly not claustrophobic. The ground can be wet and in some areas down-right slippery, so be careful. But an impressive sight to see!

itemReviewed.name: Grutas de la Catedral y El Angel

577720684.name: Almost Fell to My Untimely Demise BUT The View is Wondrous
577720684.author: a TripAdvisor user
577720684.reviewBody: They are beautiful and wondrous!  I visited them when I was around 22 or 23 - which was 20+ years ago! (woah! I\'m old!!!) 20 years ago there was no nice stair leading to the entrance.  There were not lights inside.  We didn\'t plan this trip (kids and their planning...) and when we arrived it was NOT a town but just a community.  The people living there were so friendly and kind and fun!  The usual guide with the equipment was there that day but his brother kindly said he\'d take us.  he had us hop on his truck along with his wife and extended family.  He led us in and he was the only one with the flashlight.  I was the last one in the line to enter so I couldn\'t really see at all! and only followed the flashlight ahead of me and the shadows of my friends.  I saw them make right turn and I was briefly left in the pitch dark but I wasn\'t worried because I saw where they went and groped my way through.  All of a sudden I feel my self begin to fall forward and no ground underneath my left foot and at the same time feel someone roughly yank me back from the sleeve of my jacket (wish I still had that jacket).  It was my friend who was sitting perched on one of the large boulders.  There was a 3 foot drop from where I was going to step and couldn\'t see and that ledge was only about 2 feed wide where I most certainly would\'ve probably tumbled over down down down...and squish!  Luckily it didn\'t happen!  The view was breathtaking here!  I need to go back again! (I was forced to pick a time of my visit but this only goes as far back as 2017...)

itemReviewed.name: Grutas de la Catedral y El Angel

673027114.name: Don\'t eat there
673027114.author: a TripAdvisor user
673027114.reviewBody: Waterfalls are nice... the water was really refreshing with the 106 temperature that day. You are not allowed to leave the property once you go in and pay... pack food as the food there is horrible. We ate at the Fish House...our salads had ants in it, one actually crawled from my husbands plate. His plate arrived at least 5 minutes before everyone else\'s... his fries were cold like they had been sitting around for a while. We all ended up not feeling well the next day.

666520822.name: Amazing Water
666520822.author: a TripAdvisor user
666520822.reviewBody: this place is beautiful. the water was a perfect blue and refreshing. not too cold at all. there were lots of area for all types of people to swim in. it is definitely a place u would take all ur family for vacation. not too many pics because we got in the water immediately

437242380.name: Heaven
437242380.author: a TripAdvisor user
437242380.reviewBody: Beautiful place, a piece of heaven as some say, as you paddle on the river everything that surrounds you it\'s just amazing, parrots flying, birds singing and small waterfalls among the way! You must visit.

359167867.name: Beautiful place, too bad for holy week!
359167867.author: a TripAdvisor user
359167867.reviewBody: The place its a real beauty, a beautiful waterfalls definitely. Too bad for holy week visit, a lot of people, impossible to admire and swim.

321477293.name: Relaxing place to swim,
321477293.author: a TripAdvisor user
321477293.reviewBody: Cheap, the place has parking,  places to eat, bridges And banks very close to the waterfalls,  so you can  swim or only enjoy the view.

274799873.name: Huasteca Potosina, State of San Luis Potosi Waterfalls Exploration !
274799873.author: a TripAdvisor user
274799873.reviewBody: Tamasopo Waterfalls, Puente de Dios....followed by the Laguna de la Media Luna were the highlight of our Huasteca Potosina trip.

268341369.name: Beautiful place to go with your family
268341369.author: a TripAdvisor user
268341369.reviewBody: It is like a big natural pool with beautiful water falls.  You can go with your family. Kids of all ages will have a great time and is very relaxing for adults. The food is very good and the prices are cheap.

224088223.name: I went two days in a row.
224088223.author: a TripAdvisor user
224088223.reviewBody: Well Tamasopo, is not that big, so you can do your travel and during the afternoon you just go here, there is a fee to enter, but it\'s so small it doesn\'t even matter.\nYou can explore a little bit of the jungle surrounding the falls as well, it\'s quite nice.

132977019.name: Tamasopo Waterfalls
132977019.author: a TripAdvisor user
132977019.reviewBody: Tamasopo is a little town in San Luis Potos\u00ed. Here is a beautiful place with waterfalls, rivers and traditional food in little restaurants. Near this place is the waterfall "Puente de Dios", alongside the old train station "El Cafetal"

557165011.name: Very folkloric experience
557165011.author: a TripAdvisor user
557165011.reviewBody: To become a better attraction, this place needs some attention. Finding a parking spot not an efficient activity. Spent a Sunday afternoon walking around. Not too special. Food stalls were plenty but you have to be adventurous. The Dam, the main attraction, lacked details. Lake beyond looked dirty. Kids attraction: sliding down a slope in wooden crate a bit too basic. Unless they upgrade this place a bit, I will not recommend it as an attraction.

277741178.name: A nice place to visit and go away from the noise
277741178.author: a TripAdvisor user
277741178.reviewBody: The Dam of San Jose is a nice place to visit and go away from the noise. I was there with a few friends and the trip was a good walk. The Architecture of the dam is interesting but need some attention and small restorations here and there.

277657757.name: Nice but not worth going out of your way to see.
277657757.author: a TripAdvisor user
277657757.reviewBody: I took my son here one afternoon since he had a Soccer game nearby at the Club San Luis training camp.   We had a fun few hours walking around and going up to the top of the dam.  There are also a few restaurants serving up Gorditas in the area. A very memorable afternoon for something different.  It was crazy watching people sliding down the cement sides on cardboxes and garbage can lids, and whatever they could find.  If you go, make sure you have transport back home. We actually had to ask a police truck to give us a lift out of the area since we could not get a taxi to come get us.

273859589.name: quite simple
273859589.author: a TripAdvisor user
273859589.reviewBody: Beautiful , but doesn\'t have a excellent estructure, there\'s not people taking care of the place, on weekends you can found to many kind of mini restaurants of tradicional mexican food, and the water dam unfortunately is getting dry, because there\'s not enough rain in the year

226638040.name: Good place to workout
226638040.author: a TripAdvisor user
226638040.reviewBody: It is a particular place in San Luis Potos\u00ed, you can go with your family commonly in a Sunday. People go to walk with their dogs, they go running, and after that go can have a mexican dish for lunch: "gorditas".

664308302.name: a beautiful promenade leading to a sacred space
664308302.author: a TripAdvisor user
664308302.reviewBody: in march the jacarandas in bloom add to the beauty of this place,  the church facade is exceptional.  don\'t miss the small chapel to the left of the main altar with its gold-encrusted facade.

itemReviewed.name: Santuario Basilica de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

659110721.name: Good church near to the new Arts Centre.
659110721.author: a TripAdvisor user
659110721.reviewBody: This is just down from the Art Centre, so if you are seeing the one, it is worth walking down to the end of the Calzada de Guadalupe to see the church.  The interior is mainly 19th decoration, but the sacristy has some good earlier paintings.

itemReviewed.name: Santuario Basilica de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

657862828.name: One of the many beautiful churches in SLP
657862828.author: a TripAdvisor user
657862828.reviewBody: One never gets tired of visiting the beautiful churches of Mexico., whether they be in urban areas such as San Luis or more rural areas such as Dolores Hidalgo. Each one is unique, always highly decorated and very active in responding to the needs of the churchgoers, which seem very plentiful in Mexico

itemReviewed.name: Santuario Basilica de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

472219952.name: Here the spirit is everywhere.
472219952.author: a TripAdvisor user
472219952.reviewBody: At any hour of the day you can step from the hot sun and busy streets into tranquil peacefulness and the spiritual openness of another era.

itemReviewed.name: Santuario Basilica de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

607593405.name: By far the best attraction I have ever seen in Mexico
607593405.author: a TripAdvisor user
607593405.reviewBody: My mouth just dropped as I walk in into the cave of the sun (cueva del sol) this cave is highly impressive, I have been for 4 times to the Golondrinas cave, and is super interesting, but this place Mantetzulel is the most impressive cave area I have ever seen, the main attraction is  the cave of the sun, is just amazing and spectacular, I highly recommend it

674047675.name: El agua clara bell\u00edsimo
674047675.author: a TripAdvisor user
674047675.reviewBody: El camino las monta\u00f1as el verde hasta llegar al nacimiento del agua como su nombre dice creo que me cobraron \ud83d\udd4a10 o 20 pesos el acceso hay vestidores donde cambiarse unos restaurantitos sencillos donde comer! Hay Taxys para subir y bajar al pueblo o son aproximadamente 4km de caminata!!! Muy bello hay peses que te besan en el agua maravilla

613145427.name: Diferente...
613145427.author: a TripAdvisor user
613145427.reviewBody: Se puede observar el nacimiento del agua entre las rocas, el agua es cristalina en el area profunda, el agua es heladisima! Es recomendable llevar zapatos de agua y ahi consigues comida, bebida, elotes, etc. Ademas te rentan salvavidas y flotantes para los ni\u00f1os. Nosotros fuimos en domingo y parecia balneario, pero dicen que entre semana es muy tranquilo.

602809795.name: Huasteca Potosina 2018
602809795.author: a TripAdvisor user
602809795.reviewBody: Un lugar muy recomendable cuando visiten la Huasteca Potosina , muy hermoso eso si el agua es demasiada fr\u00eda por si te gusta refrescarte es el lugar perfecto , excelente para los ni\u00f1os ya que hay muchas partes en que la profundidad es muy baja y el agua muy cristalina....y es muy barato la entrada.

562118401.name: nacimiento de agua
562118401.author: a TripAdvisor user
562118401.reviewBody: impresionante, nacimiento natural, en huichihuayan, donde tambien se puede nadar, ver donde nace el  agua, comer una tradicional nieve, unas enchiladas huastecas y mucho mas les recomiendo viajar con sorprendente tour, estan en facebook, en tripadvisor airbnb.

547088781.name: La direcci\u00f3n est\u00e1 mal
547088781.author: a TripAdvisor user
547088781.reviewBody: La direcci\u00f3n proporcionada en el sitio es incorrecta. La segu\u00ed y me llevo a una colonia donde no hay nada\n

539089713.name: Este Nacimiento esta en Huichihuayan Mpio de Hueuetlan,Hueuetlan esta en la sierra y Huichi es en la parte baja.
539089713.author: a TripAdvisor user
539089713.reviewBody: Acudir al Nacimiento no solo es interesante el agua.Es zona ind\u00edgena donde se puede comer un incre\u00edble zacahuil y las inimitables enchiladas Huastecas y si se  acude a los boh\u00edos cercanos el camar\u00f3n de rio o Acamaya.El Naciiento es agua fr\u00eda no hay contaminaci\u00f3n si tiene una de ba\u00f1os no hay muchas \u00e1reas de venta.Mucho paso de indigenas que bajan de sus comunidades cerca de \u00e1rea de agua Mucha seguridad y limpieza,quizas haga falta mayor \u00e1rea de estacionamiento.

521270238.name: Agua super fria!
521270238.author: a TripAdvisor user
521270238.reviewBody: de los rios con agua m\u00e1s fria que he ido pero est\u00e1 super bien cuando la temperatura ambiente es muuy caliente. entrar de clavado al agua se te quita rapidisimo.

510307822.name: Muy Frio
510307822.author: a TripAdvisor user
510307822.reviewBody:
El lugar esta muy bonito.

para llegar hay que ir directo al poblado de El nacimiento.
esta en esta ubicación:
21.459694, -98.976639

El lugar es muy fácil de acceder.

Tiene su propio estacionamiento muy amplio.

Ahí mismo te pueden vender un traje de baño. 
El agua es sumamente fría.

pasamos todo el día en ese lugar. Es excelente para comer ahí, con algo para llevar.

todo el camino hasta ahí es pavimentado así que no debe ser un problema para vehículos pequeños.

416275348.name: No lo visiten en agosto o julio!!!
416275348.author: a TripAdvisor user
416275348.reviewBody: Pues yo fui en mala \u00e9poca del a\u00f1o, no pude apreciar el color del r\u00edo o sus claras aguas. Sin embargo su belleza en inminente, un lugar muy bonito y hay muchos espacios para que vayan muchas familias a divertirse. Venden unos elotes super ricos. En fin si est\u00e1n en SLP deben de ir, se llama as\u00ed porque se supone que ah\u00ed nace el r\u00edo.

361231280.name: Divertido, natural y local
361231280.author: a TripAdvisor user
361231280.reviewBody: Pintoresco, un lugar como para los locales pero se puede apreciar c\u00f3mo es la diversi\u00f3n local. El agua extremadamente fr\u00eda, clara y con muchos peces, limpio y muy barato solo 10 pesos la entrada y los ni\u00f1os gratis. Te entran colchones para el agua en 20 pesos la hr. Llevar zapato acu\u00e1tico porque hay piedras en el r\u00edo.

291538963.name: Muy bello
291538963.author: a TripAdvisor user
291538963.reviewBody: Esta muy bello el lugar, se paga 10 pesos de entrada muy tranquilo aunque falta seguridad porque la corriente del r\u00edo es bastante fuerte y esta muy fr\u00eda el agua, vestidores y ba\u00f1os limpios y los elotes que vende el se\u00f1or est\u00e1n deliciosos!!!

229626988.name: El Nacimiento del R\u00edo Huichihuaya y la Cueva de Las Quilas
229626988.author: a TripAdvisor user
229626988.reviewBody:
Este recorrido es fascinante. Llegamos al nacimiento del Río Huichihuaya y pagamos una entrada de $10 MXP por persona. Ahí, se tiene una espectacular vista al nacimiento del río. Algunas personas nadan, pero la corriente del río es muy fuerte. También se puede caminar por el área y se puede comer con las señoras locales que preparan comida. Hay baños y vestidores bastante limpios. 

Además, hay niños que te pueden llevar a un recorrido por la cueva de Las Quilas. Es una caminata mediana a través del pueblo hasta la cueva. Para nuestro grupo fue toda una aventura porque como fuimos en septiembre, había mucho lodo y el piso estaba resbaladizo. Sin embargo, los lugareños te permitían cruzar por sus casas para evitar las zonas más lodosas. En el recorrido, se veían muchas gallinas con sus pollitos, y perros con sus cachorros. Al llegar a Las Quilas, que se llaman como el grupo de mujeres de la zona, pagamos $10 MXP por persona para entrar. El niño que nos guiaba nos dio una explicación extensa de las figuras que se veían en las rocas. Lo más bonito fue llegar a ese lugar tan recóndito y admirar la belleza natural. 

Me encantó el trato de la gente... todos muy cálidos y serviciales. En el pueblo, nos agradecía la gente que fuéramos a visitar. Una persona que iba en nuestro grupo optó por no hacer el recorrido y quedarse en los restaurantes que fueron deliciosos y baratos. Creo que la humildad y la sencillez de la gente le agregan a la belleza natural de la zona. 

Si optan por ir hasta las cuevas, recomiendo ampliamente ir con pantalón largo y zapato cerrado, sobretodo en época lluviosa. Dos personas de nuestro grupo vieron a una víbora andar muy cerca, por lo que es importante extremar precauciones.

659390978.name: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder
659390978.author: a TripAdvisor user
659390978.reviewBody: Like claifcasi a previous reviewer, on aesthetic value, without fully understanding the meaning behind the work I thought the sculptures were ugly and clunky. Yes I also almost fell over myself inside the museum.

620863498.name: Be careful
620863498.author: a TripAdvisor user
620863498.reviewBody: This museum, which features large, monumental sculptures which I think are ugly, is very dimly lit, for effect no doubt. A result, however, is that it\'s difficult to see the floor when it changes levels. Twice I\'ve fallen. Be careful.

559882282.name: Nice
559882282.author: a TripAdvisor user
559882282.reviewBody: Nice little museum in a beautiful artistically modern building. Some very nice sculptures, modern pieces of art, and drawings make up the collection.  Worth a visit.

459344124.name: Transformers were created here
459344124.author: a TripAdvisor user
459344124.reviewBody: The large sculptures by Federico Silva remind me of transformers.\nWhich came first the sculptures or the transformers, I do not know.\nThe design of the museum is top notch.

436697212.name: A different museum
436697212.author: a TripAdvisor user
436697212.reviewBody: I have been to hundreds of museums, but never have seen a place like Museo Silva Federico dedicated to sculptures only. Very well laid out and presentation of the artwork of Federico Silvo who I never had heard about before. I was skeptical when I entered but left very positively impressed when I left it. Certainly can recommend this little jewel in San Luis Potos\u00ed.

426488880.name: FANTASTIC!
426488880.author: a TripAdvisor user
426488880.reviewBody: The building itself is worth a visit but Silva\'s sculptures are amazing - and evocative of other, ancient Mexican sculpture and ruins. A must to visit in this marvellous city.

323265326.name: Impresionante!
323265326.author: a TripAdvisor user
323265326.reviewBody: A strikingly beautiful display of Silva\'s monumental works. Wonderfully mounted and lit, the pieces create their own ambiance.  Along with track lighting there is natural light allowing for changes in mood and effect.  I visited early on a Sunday and the galleries were empty.  There were young docents eager to offer me a tour; their commentary and information added significantly to a very pleasurable visit.

262759411.name: Excellent sculpture museum of a renowned regional sculptor!
262759411.author: a TripAdvisor user
262759411.reviewBody: Excellent sculpture museum of a renowned regional sculptor! Really cool to see a lot of sculptures with Native Indigenous Mexican influence!

233819947.name: Cool!
233819947.author: a TripAdvisor user
233819947.reviewBody: I had never even heard of sculptor Federico Silva until I walked into this museum, located in exquisitely restored former school and hospital. I particularly enjoyed the juxtaposition of the classic lines of the building with the looming modernity of Silva\'s creations.

215963118.name: Impressive Scultpure
215963118.author: a TripAdvisor user
215963118.reviewBody: The museum\'s dedicated to sculpture (or it was when I visited) and it\'s quite impressive. The first floor is occupied by the concrete works of Silva, and the upstairs had a beautiful exhibit of metal sculptures that complimented Silva\'s works nicely.

190345768.name: Amazingly Wonderful!
190345768.author: a TripAdvisor user
190345768.reviewBody: We had never heard of the sculptor before, and took a chance, and we are now big fans.  This museum is so amazing from the monumental sculptures that capture the flavor of the pre-Hispanic icons to the beautiful setting that they are displayed in.  This is one of the most impressive museums we have ever visited \u2013 and we\u2019ve see a lot.  DO NOT MISS THIS!

666522287.name: amazing water
666522287.author: a TripAdvisor user
666522287.reviewBody: this place is beautiful. the water is so blue and not too cold. it\'s a long walk but definitely worth it. you have to wear a life jacket in order to get it. there is a long rope in both directions to hold onto if ur not a strong swimmer. the younger and more active ppl jump into the water from the rocks. others use the other entrance a little further into the area. definitely a place to visit while there aren\'t alot of ppl. we were lucky enough to arrive when about 100 teens were leaving and stayed for about 2 hours when another 100 teens arrived. we went right before Semana Santa. there is a place for u to leave ur things- like cubbys, for 30 pesos ($1.50 US). there is also a small place to change, we didnt use it so I didnt see the inside. also make sure u have water shoes and take a good water camera.

address.streetAddress: Adolfo Lopez Mateos Carretera Tamasopo - Agua Buena Km 2

614658867.name: Honors it\'s name Puente de Dios ! ( Bridge of God)
614658867.author: a TripAdvisor user
614658867.reviewBody: Visited Puente de Dios with my husband, apparently the September was the perfect month to visit to avoid large crowds! There were few visitors so my pictures and adventure both turned out to be just perfect. In a fresh water water fall scene that was clean and the view was just breath taking to climb and jump of numerous times with no issue.\n\nI absolutely recommend you visit this place to have a beautiful experience just like we did. Be sure to take your non slip water shoes and climb stairs!

address.streetAddress: Adolfo Lopez Mateos Carretera Tamasopo - Agua Buena Km 2

586691487.name: For teens and toddles
586691487.author: a TripAdvisor user
586691487.reviewBody: I had the opportunity to visit with my family. One teen and a toddle. Great place. I travel whit my baby life vest. If you are going to visit lost of places with water I recommend to bring your own life vests (you will save 1.5 dlls in each spot per person). My hubby and teen daughter jump a lot to the water and enter to the \u201cPuente de Dios\u201d while I was with the baby in a perfect spot were she had a great time (just continue walking up after the last rental of vests). Then my husban took care of the baby and I had the opportunity to do the jumps with my teen daughter. The entrence is 45 pesos (4 years and up) and the parking is 20 pesos. When you park use the parking restroom you will save 10 pesos if you use the ones 10 feet away out the parking. Don\u2019t forget to visit. Theres no food inside. Lifeguard are taking care of you. We loved it. \nThe only thing I didn\u2019t like is that people can bring alcohol and music inside. Recomend going during the week. You can camp there if you like.

address.streetAddress: Adolfo Lopez Mateos Carretera Tamasopo - Agua Buena Km 2

355900273.name: My favourite house in San Luis
355900273.author: a TripAdvisor user
355900273.reviewBody: This museum used to be the house of a well-known family in San Luis and when my mother was a child she remembers going there to spend an afternoon by the poo, and enjoy a light lnch with the owners. It is a beautiful house and they have gathered a great collection of art. On Saturday afternoon and Su day mornings there are concerts and events. For the 4th of. july they have a fun and peculiar American celebration.

328909984.name: Worth the while!
328909984.author: a TripAdvisor user
328909984.reviewBody: Very beautiful building, interesting paintings (the exhibitions change) and a decent collection of ancient sculptures.

288887282.name: If you only visit one Museum in SLP, this is it.
288887282.author: a TripAdvisor user
288887282.reviewBody:
In all my years of coming to SLP for business and shopping I must have passed by this place dozens of times without bothering to see what it actually was.  It is a bit out of the way down Carranza street, but  easily reached by taxi (or bus) and perhaps walking distance from el centro for those that like long walks. 

Well due to a question on the TA forums of "what would be the best museum to visit if you only had one afternoon in SLP?" , I have set off on a quest of slowly visiting every museum in the capital in search of the answer.

I took my teen aged kids with me and we thoroughly enjoyed the museum.  There are several sections. One with antique furniture that have been collected and preserved, an excellent Pre-Colombian section of the museum, which specializes in the Native Huastecan civilizations. Honestly you can be absorbed for hours in this part if you wish to read and carefully look at each exhibit.  It's all fascinating.

 Upstairs there is an Art gallery which I was told rotates every few months, and another section with religious artifacts and paintings, furniture etc. 

 Outside there is a cafe and a really nice Cactus garden. 

 The museum is so much better and complete then any of the museums we have seen in el Centro de SLP. We will definitely be coming back in the near future.

233824699.name: Not in my guidebook
233824699.author: a TripAdvisor user
233824699.reviewBody: I was taking advantage of the Sunday shutdown of streets, wandering well out of the traditional Centro through a neighborhood consisting of mansions recycled into banks, boutiques, restaurants, clubs.... and museum! It was a lovely relaxing space. Not much had been done to reshape the former living space except to fill it with lovely art. Very friendly staff.

230544693.name: Excellent museum
230544693.author: a TripAdvisor user
230544693.reviewBody: I\'ve been to this museum twice, once with my wife and on another occasion during celebration of Mexican indepencence day.  it has a surprisingly good collection of art and native artifacts and on the day of our first visit, a displace of Mexican modern art which was just excellent.  while limited, it\'s interesting enough for a two hour visit and very accessible.

623881562.name: Beautiful place to walk!
623881562.author: a TripAdvisor user
623881562.reviewBody: Set in a lovely town, this garden is made for walking and people watching. People are strolling with their children and the cutest bunch of dogs ever and grandmas sitting and knitting.

588380872.name: Pleasant park
588380872.author: a TripAdvisor user
588380872.reviewBody: A pleasant quite park with a few restaurants and bars around the corner. Close to the centre of town.

539323131.name: My favorite plaza in SLP
539323131.author: a TripAdvisor user
539323131.reviewBody: This expansive plaza is a really great place to hang out, enjoy the architecture, relax, people watch, or grab a snack.  Top notch.

451795846.name: History Alive1
451795846.author: a TripAdvisor user
451795846.reviewBody: Mexico does not communicate with the world about the hidden gems it has. Jardin Hidalgo is one of those gems. You can see locals enjoying their city, tourists learning about this amazing city. This park is great to sit down and have a bite to eat from a local vendor and plan your day. Many great places to visit within walking distance.

314998848.name: Most beautiful square in San Luis
314998848.author: a TripAdvisor user
314998848.reviewBody: Mexico is famous for the multi-square architecture of its main cities, and San Luis just follows this style. Yet, of the 3 or 4 squares you can find in the very center of San Luis this is definitely the most beautiful one, and not only because of its size. The main cathedral, the state government building, the tourist office and a couple of San Luis\'s finest and most antique coffee houses are just here. Plus, there is a nice garden with a tiny decorated gazebo in the middle of it; and the square is one of the main meeting points of people, especially for their Sunday stroll.

262760084.name: Lively Plaza with lots of activity in SLP ... walking only (which is great)!!!
262760084.author: a TripAdvisor user
262760084.reviewBody: Lively Plaza with lots of activity in SLP ... walking only (which is great)!!! I really enjoyed the  passionate atmosphere with lovers and families ... really nice!!

233821523.name: \u00a1Viva la musica!
233821523.author: a TripAdvisor user
233821523.reviewBody: This is not really a "jardin," although it does have plants. It is SLP\'s Plaza de Armas, dominated by the Catedral and the Palacio de Gobierno, and the center of SLP life, and a place kf mucha musica, like much of SLP. I have never been anywhere where there was so much music, ranging from organized concerts in the Plaza to stray rock bands on random corners. It\'s a fantastic city more or less unknown by tourists. Go!

215962778.name: Very Old, Very Quaint
215962778.author: a TripAdvisor user
215962778.reviewBody: Much like most of the parks/squares in Mexico - Lots to look at architecturally - Easy to get to and near most of the surroundings jardins.

137018690.name: Gorgeous
137018690.author: a TripAdvisor user
137018690.reviewBody: Do not miss this great park.. so relaxing to wander around in.. unusual designs and perfectly safe and clean... local lovers smooch around here on the benchs soooooo.  why not join them ?

662295075.name: Clean up on aisle seven please...
662295075.author: a TripAdvisor user
662295075.reviewBody:
Another great building with good information but in this case, even when under glass/plastic cases, they are covered with years of dust and dirt so you lose the color, the texture, the beauty of each piece.  What would it take to open each case, clean up, then reseal them properly so the pieces stay pristine longer?  

The guards are a bit over-zealous and are on your heels the whole way around which gets a bit tedious after a while.  

Love that they have replicas you can touch (on any of the red pedestals).  Great idea for kids and people who cannot see too well.  

From pre-Hispanic archeology to vice regal paintings.  

On the second floor is located The Capilla de Aranzazú 1586.  A beautiful small chapel.  

Some websites say it closes at seven pm but it closes at six pm.

659109832.name: The Capilla de Aranzazu
659109832.author: a TripAdvisor user
659109832.reviewBody: This is in part of the old convent of San Francisco, the Museum has a nice small collection of objects, but for me the high light is the Capilla de Aranzaz\u00fa, which for those of us that like the Baroque, is a fascinating place to visit.

559881650.name: Nice
559881650.author: a TripAdvisor user
559881650.reviewBody: Nice little museum with some pre-Colombian artifacts from around the area and a stunningly beautiful chapel on the second floor. Free on Sundays.

498083867.name: free on Sunday
498083867.author: a TripAdvisor user
498083867.reviewBody: Decent museum, free on sunday and wasn\'t too packed. Not a big place so it will be a quick visit. I probably spent 20 minutes but I rush through museums fairly quickly.

447218630.name: Interactive
447218630.author: a TripAdvisor user
447218630.reviewBody: Of course if you are here as a tourist and visit museums, churches and chapels , etc. this is a must. \nWhat is different from other museums is that there are several fake(replicas) pieces you can touch through all the museum

442377953.name: A nice, small museum
442377953.author: a TripAdvisor user
442377953.reviewBody: I\'ve been here twice so far. The museum is housed in a former Franciscan convent, the focal point being a stunning private chapel at the top of a sunny staircase. \nIn the downstairs area are displays of precolombian artifacts from SLP and other parts of M\u00e9xico. There are many touchable exhibits which is great, considering most museums want visitors to keep their hands off. Signage is all in Spanish. The guards in the downstairs area were eager  and happy to point out interesting features and information and very accommodating to questions. \nThe museum\'s size is comfortable, easy to roam around in. Very do-able and in a nice area of downtown.

426489530.name: Unique in one way
426489530.author: a TripAdvisor user
426489530.reviewBody: There is a variety of exhibits from ancient modern, but all have counterparts that are touchable. The chapel is unusual and very colourful. also unusual: there is an elevator to take us oldsters up to the chapel.

336120023.name: Excellent local history display
336120023.author: a TripAdvisor user
336120023.reviewBody: As a visitor was curious to learn a bit more about this colonial city.  It\'s worth visiting and it only takes about an hour to see it. Pity they barely have any information in English.

233817508.name: A regional museum
233817508.author: a TripAdvisor user
233817508.reviewBody: This was a slightly better than average regional museum, fairly well organized, a block away from Parque San Francisco, in another restored monastery. But\nupstairs, Whoa!  The lavish gold and aqua private chapel Capilla de Aranzazu, in high Churrigueresque style. Don\'t you just love surprises?!

215964189.name: Architecturally Wonderful
215964189.author: a TripAdvisor user
215964189.reviewBody: The beautiful park outside is surpassed by the Neo-Classical architecture of this building - It\'s simple at times, subtle at others, and then just opulent when you least expect it. It\'s gorgeous. Oh yeah, and it\'s a museum, too, but it\'s all pretty basic stuff where that\'s concerned.

631501401.name: A good chapel to visit or be during a concert
631501401.author: a TripAdvisor user
631501401.reviewBody: It is not necessary to believe in a religion to enjoy this architectural wonder in the downtown of San Luis Potos\u00ed. It is close to the regional museum but independent to visit. You have to go up through a staircase, then be prepared if you are not very young, but the visit is necessary while visiting the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Independencia, esquina con Hermenegildo Galeana

659113155.name: Interesting building and place to visit.
659113155.author: a TripAdvisor user
659113155.reviewBody: Maybe not the first thing you would see in SLP, but this is an early 19th century building and very splendid. If you ask to be shown around, some one is usually happy to do so. The main staircase has some 20th century wall paintings, and up stairs there are some grand rooms, the \u201cpiece de resistance\u201d though is the diorama of President Juarez and Princess Salm Salm.

412745142.name: Gorguous architectural design.
412745142.author: a TripAdvisor user
412745142.reviewBody: Coming from Charlotte where everything is new and modern, these buildings afforded me the opportunity to view some amazingly beautiful structures.  I loved the facades. There are many beautiful ones here.

292939103.name: Demonstation outside
292939103.author: a TripAdvisor user
292939103.reviewBody: This palace is located at the center of SLP. I\'m not sure exactly why but there was a huge demonstration outside the palace when I visited.\n\nI couldn\'t see anywhere I could enter the palace but the building is very big and hard to miss if you visit the plaza. It\'s on the opposite side of the Cathedral of San Luis Potosi.

659552220.name: Ayer y Hoy, un viaje espiritual con los ancestros
659552220.author: a TripAdvisor user
659552220.reviewBody: el tour nocturno no apto para nerviosos, excelente para curiosos. mas importante el lazo de las culturas ancestrales que veneraban a los que nos han dejado recuerdos y conocimiento y que en el hoy ya no est\u00e1n conos otros mas que en nuestros corazones.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fray Diego de la Magdalena # 1950 El Saucito

629226892.name: Solo para personas, con nervios de acero
629226892.author: a TripAdvisor user
629226892.reviewBody:
Unicamente si disfrutas las leyendas de terror cvontinua leyendo, en caso contrario, camia de comentario.

Y es que este cementerio cuenta con infinidad de leyendas de terro entre las que destacan la de la Muerta de los siete altares, misma que es muy tragica asi como espeluznante, y es que en una noche solitaria frente al panteon una señorita  le hace la parada a un taxista y frente al cementerio y le solicita que la lleve  a siete iglesias de la ciudada pagar una manda, al terminar solicita la lleve al mismo lugar donde imicio el viaje,  al final de este ella le entrga una medalla y le solicita que pase a un domicilio a cobrar sus servicios  , por lo tarde de la madrugada el chofer no s e oruso y asi lo hizo, solo para enterarse que la señorita hace tiempo habia fallecido,  el padre de la  señorita le  liquidaba el servicio al chafirete peroe ste asustado n o quiso cobrar cayendo en cama y a los poco dias  muriendo  del susto, 

en este cementerio esta la tumba de Juan del Jarro,    otro personajhe de leyenda  que ya en otro comentario les contare  y es que  es mas apropiado comentarlo en el de Plaza de aransazu, ya que en ese lugar esta su estatua,

Muy recomendable  el tour nocturno de unos estudiantes de teatro  que  de verdad lo hacen mu tetrico, principalmente por que es de noche el espectaculo,   Te atreves ?

muchas gracias

address.streetAddress: Av. Fray Diego de la Magdalena # 1950 El Saucito

603706036.name: Chihuahuenses en San Luis
603706036.author: a TripAdvisor user
603706036.reviewBody: Nos encantaron los monumentos y las historias enterradas en ellos, aparte lo t\u00e9trico de unas de sus muchas tumbas que datan de los 1800\u2019s, excelente lugar y sin duda un buen lugar para conocer m\u00e1s de el \u201cviejo\u201d San Luis Potos\u00ed.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fray Diego de la Magdalena # 1950 El Saucito

432290821.name: Exelente lugar para d\u00eda de muertos
432290821.author: a TripAdvisor user
432290821.reviewBody: Me encanta este lugar ya que existe afuera del pante\u00f3n exquisitos platillos t\u00edpicos,como enchiladas potosinas,y gran variedad de antijitos mexicanos  y dentro del pante\u00f3n una serie de tumbas muy bien acomodadas, y se nota que ya no caben mas.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fray Diego de la Magdalena # 1950 El Saucito

369692762.name: Pante\u00f3n Municipal El Saucito, arte sacro
369692762.author: a TripAdvisor user
369692762.reviewBody: A mi me gusta ir al pante\u00f3n despu\u00e9s de que el sol deja de brillar en todo su esplendor, pues a esas horas de mi visita es menos caluroso (6pm) y aprovecho cuando se hacen recorridos con un gu\u00eda por las noches (por parte de Turismo Municipal) porque nos van mostrando las tumbas m\u00e1s significativas, de personajes ilustres que han permanecido en nuestro bello estado de San Luis Potos\u00ed, y que escribieron nuestra historia.

291811174.name: Ay nanita
291811174.author: a TripAdvisor user
291811174.reviewBody: Este pante\u00f3n es el m\u00e1s grande que he visitado, fuimos a buscar a mis abuelos, si como no, imposible si no tienes los datos, est\u00e1 grand\u00edsimo lo que sigue. Recorrimos lo m\u00e1s que pudimos antes de morirnos de calor y cansancio pero vimos unas tumbas incre\u00edbles sobre todo en la avenida principal donde est\u00e1n los muertos riquillos, pero adentro dense una vuelta, hay una esculturas muy bellas y hay otras tumbas harto divertidas. L\u00e1stima que nunca pudimos ir los \u00faltimos viernes de cada mes donde hay una funci\u00f3n especial en la noche, dicen que est\u00e1 padr\u00edsima, he de regresar.

268756583.name: Una noche de...

268756583.reviewBody: Pues la verdad falta un poco m\u00e1s de organizaci\u00f3n por parte del grupo que hacen representaciones, en cuesti\u00f3n de horarios (puntualidad).\nLas personas cuentan amenamente las historias de varios personajes enterrados en este antiguo cementerio.

258077420.name: FABULOSOS EJEMPLOS DE ARTE FUNERARIO
258077420.author: a TripAdvisor user
258077420.reviewBody:
México posee extraordinarios ejemplos de arte funerario y el Panteón Municipal de El Saucito, al norte de la capital potosina, es un punto de referencia que debes visitar.

¿Cómo llegar?
Si no llevas auto, la ruta 1 te lleva.

¿Por qué visitarlo?
1. No te cuesta un peso entrar.
2. Encierra extraordinarios ejemplos de arte funerario: monumentos del siglo XIX de estilos neogótico, ecléctico y algunos de siglo XX art déco (algunas en buen estado de conservación, específicamente las de la calle principal).
3. Es una forma inusual de disfrutar un destino turístico.

No vayas si te desagrada la idea de pisar un cementerio.

Muchos monumentos funerarios están verdaderamente deteriorados. Este tipo de arte en México está en riesgo por el abandono y desgaste que el tiempo produce. Vale la pena conocer este lugar y tomar fotografías.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fray Diego de la Magdalena # 1950 El Saucito

253383264.name: Un ugar paraq recordar.
253383264.author: a TripAdvisor user
253383264.reviewBody: A pesar de las aglomeraciones en su acceso, el ingreso permite recordar que solo estamos de paso por este mundo, recorrer sus pasillo y encontrar tumbas de considerable antig\u00fcedad, transforma la visi\u00f3n de la vida y la muerte misma.

251551841.name: Excelente, misterioso e interesante
251551841.author: a TripAdvisor user
251551841.reviewBody: Este lugar es uno de los que tienen m\u00e1s historia de san Luis, para ser\u00eda hasta un poco m\u00e1gico-misterioso tiene mucha historia, tiene tumbas realmente interesantes e incre\u00edbles, vale la pena visitarlo y dar un recorrido de los que el departamento de cultura ofrece es muy bueno y es en la noche pero no es para encontrar fantasmas al contrario es recorrido hist\u00f3rico y hasta hacen obras de teatro y son gratis, y ya sea ir por su cuenta y rondar por ah\u00ed o en el recorrido vale la pena conocerlo y recorrerlo

address.streetAddress: Av. Fray Diego de la Magdalena # 1950 El Saucito

235637655.name: La cultura es muy diversificada-amplia
235637655.author: a TripAdvisor user
235637655.reviewBody: Aparte de los teatros, iglesias, museos, restaurantes, discotecas, jard\u00ednes, plazas, centros comerciales, cines, arquitectura, etc., mi bello San Luis Potos\u00ed cuenta con uno de los panteones m\u00e1s bellos a nivel nacional. \u00bfPor qu\u00e9 aseguro esto? Porque tambi\u00e9n es bello el de Aguascalientes y el de Zacatecas. \u00bfQu\u00e9 lo embellece? El arte a detalle aplicado en la edificaci\u00f3n de tumbas que datan de entre los a\u00f1os 1800 y 1900, y esto lo pueden ustedes observar en el Pante\u00f3n Municipal de El Saucito.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fray Diego de la Magdalena # 1950 El Saucito

216682805.name: Visita vespertina por el Pante\u00f3n del Saucito
216682805.author: a TripAdvisor user
216682805.reviewBody: No todo lo es Centro Hist\u00f3rico, Museos, Balnearios, Cine, Restaurantes, Arqueolog\u00eda;  Noooo amiguitos, tambi\u00e9n el arte sacro es una belleza primordial, porque captar\u00e1s la elegancia de su arquitectura, delicadeza ornamental, mensajes curiosos en las criptas, antig\u00fcedad de sepulcros que aunque ya no tengan familiares que velen por ellos, el hecho de tenerlos A Perpetuidad, Gobierno los mantendr\u00e1 en nuestras vidas cotidianas por nuestro paso hacia la visita de nuestros familiares ya idos.\n\nTe sorprender\u00e1s que esta visita sacra la disfrutas tanto en pareja como familiarmente, como entre amigos, o hasta en solitario.  Es muy vers\u00e1til el paseo y m\u00e1s si vas en compa\u00f1\u00eda de un gu\u00eda o historiador del la localidad.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fray Diego de la Magdalena # 1950 El Saucito

559882873.name: Okay
559882873.author: a TripAdvisor user
559882873.reviewBody: An okay smallish museum housed in a beautiful building.  Not a lot of displays, but the different uniforms worn by the various orders is interesting.  Only 15 pesos, which is nothing.

itemReviewed.name: Vista desde el Museo del Virreinato

497141125.name: Retablos and beautiful building
497141125.author: a TripAdvisor user
497141125.reviewBody: This small museum is worth a visit to anyone interested in the Vice Regal Spanish colonial era. Walking through the musuem, one can envision life during the 16th - early 19th century for the priveleged peninsulares/gapuchines. The collection is not extensive but of interest and I particulary enjoyed the retablos galleries. I\'ve seen these devotions elsewhere in Mexico and the previous Mexican states in the U.S. and appreciated the explanation and art itself.

itemReviewed.name: Vista desde el Museo del Virreinato

385007995.name: Small but worth a visit
385007995.author: a TripAdvisor user
385007995.reviewBody: If you are in SLP anyway, drop in.  For 15 pesos it has the best descriptions of the costumes worn by early clergy.  If you\'re into that, it\'s a great display.  A little bit of paintings, hardware and ceramics for a brief exploration of SLP\'s history with the Spanish.

itemReviewed.name: Vista desde el Museo del Virreinato

238045434.name: Beautifull building but not much to see inside
238045434.author: a TripAdvisor user
238045434.reviewBody: The museum has very few objects inside.  The only room I liked is the one with the old maps, which I found quite interesting.   If your visit is short, you can skip this.  You can admire the building from Plaza del Carmen

itemReviewed.name: Vista desde el Museo del Virreinato

233826000.name: "The view from the museum of the vice-regency?????"
233826000.author: a TripAdvisor user
233826000.reviewBody: What kind of Anne is that for an attraction? The view consists of the very pretty Plaza del Carmen and, if you turn your head, the even prettier Templo del Carmen. During part of the week, the plaza doubles as an open air market, and all the prettiness is hidden under a sea of booths. As for the Museo Virreanal, it needs its own attraction site!
